item.title: 1116 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—big time | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s English expression and dialog: on a large scale—often HIGHLY successful I started an English camp in China a few weeks ago. Teaching English? Yeah, LIVE classes focusing on listening and speaking. Wow!! That’ll be useful big time! GET FREE LESSONS: I’m on iTunes and everywhere else they have podcasts! Coach Shane? They’re tasty. A little buttery~ But he slices them too thin. He means well!

More smarter?! It sounds like a snake oil to me~ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0884 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—dying to DO SMT & die vs dye | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast

Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: dying to DO SMT & die vs dye I’m dying to dye your hair. Um, no thanks. But you’re graying. Dyeing is a good thing. I’d rather die than dye. Nice try. Good bye.

item.title: 0883 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—know which side your bread is buttered on | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast

Yeah, I know which side my bread is buttered on, but… So, if you want that money, be nice to Jim.

Maybe something at a coffee shop. You are so mean. What? You think working at a coffee shop is easy?

item.title: 0872 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a stand-up guy | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Are you trying to be the BEST that you can be? The best at work, at school, at home? Sometimes? Well, a sign of a good man (and woman!), is when he always tries to do his best everywhere he goes. We are humans so we make mistakes. But when our mistakes bring us down…we need to stand up again. And we need to try again. DOING is much more powerful that saying.

item.title: 0871 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—weed | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast

item.title: 0863 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—give it a shot | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast

item.title: 0862 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to take apart | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast

I did. Why? Why did you take apart every little piece? You asked me to wash it~ Use a sponge!

item.title: 0861 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to take part | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Monday, Monday~~~ I like Mondays–it’s a fresh start to a brand new week, I get to work with people I like, I get to solve a few problems, I get to create some new material…LOTS of work, but I like it! I hope you enjoy your Mondays, too! But what about English?!! Well, it’s 2018–as you look at the year ahead; do you have some specific plans? Anything you will participate in?

item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!! Happy Friday, everyone! In today’s podcast I’ll teach you 15 Nicknames of Big American cities! What about the cities in your country? Teach us the nicknames! Have a super weekend, Coach Shane The E-cubed PODCAST is UP and READY for YOU!! #LearnEnglish #ESL #LMEtoday #LetsMasterEnglish Today’s English expression and dialog: Big city nicknames You’re moving to the Windy City? I might! I’m sick of Sin City. You lived in the Big Apple before, right?

item.title: 0859 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—on the off chance | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday! WOW…very busy day today. Two LIVE classes with PIRF VIP students, a new DDM assignment, Lesson videos for PIRF and a new PIRF assignment. I look forward to having a day off!! How’s your day going? Are you ready for some English? Today’s expression is REALLY simple…but when most students see it or hear it, they are COMPLETELY confused! Check out the podcast! The E-cubed PODCAST is UP and READY for YOU!

item.title: 0858 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Lucky me~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday!! Today we have an expression that we can use when GOOD things happen AND when BAD things happen! But make sure you say it “properly”! I’ll teach you! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Lucky me~ Your dance partner will be Fred. Lucky me~ Why? You don’t like Fred? Well…it’s just…he doesn’t brush her teeth. You won’t be kissing him! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0857 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to upstage somebody | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s TUESDAY!! I hope you are doing great^^ Being competitive is really good–it’s important for your survival! But NOT ALWAYS! If you are super competitive, you need today’s podcast! Have a super day, Coach Shane The E-cubed PODCAST is UP and READY for YOU!! #LearnEnglish #ESL #LMEtoday #LetsMasterEnglish Today’s English expression and dialog: to upstage somebody Have you been working out? Yeah. A little. Why? Ha! You’re working out because Brian’s working out!

item.title: 0856 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—the lesser of two evils | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday!! Right?! I hope your week is super–and not too busy! We make CHOICES every day–sometimes those choices are difficult because BOTH options are BAD! So you need today’s podcast to help!! The E-cubed PODCAST is UP and READY for YOU!! #LearnEnglish #ESL #LMEtoday #LetsMasterEnglish Today’s English expression and dialog: the lesser of two evils What’s that? Pumpkin Spice Latte? Caramel Macchiato. No! Those are so bad for you!

item.title: 0855 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—you would think | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description How are you doing today?! Busy day or light day? For me, it’s a VERY busy day, but I like it! A new DDM lesson, a new PIRF lesson! And…a new podcast for YOU! Today’s expression is GREAT–3 simple words, but do you know HOW and WHEN to use them? Learn today! Your English coach, Shane PS. Regarding out SALE: Yearly Sale ends tonight, Quarterly Sale ends tomorrow night and the Monthly Sale ends Sunday night.

item.title: 0854 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Viewer discretion is advised. | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Hello everyone!! Today we have a great expression that you had BETTER know. You’ll hear it and read it. And if you don’t understand…you might be sorry! PLEASE SHARE this podcast if you like it! That really helps! Have a super day! Coach Shane The E-cubed PODCAST is UP and READY for YOU!! #LearnEnglish #ESL #LMEtoday #LetsMasterEnglish Today’s English expression and dialog: Viewer discretion is advised. Alright, let me tell you how I got divorced.

item.title: 0853 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—like vs as | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description MOST people are back to work today…I hope you survived! It’s 2018–YOU can make it great! And I’ll help you with your English! Let’s Master English together!! The E-cubed PODCAST is UP and READY for YOU!! #LearnEnglish #ESL #LMEtoday #LetsMasterEnglish Happy New Year, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: like vs as I wish I were more confident. Maybe you should act like your brother. You want me to act as if I were Jimmy?

item.title: 0852 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—in broad daylight | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY NEW YEAR!!! I will do my best to help you with your English this year! If you like what I do, please share my lessons, join my classes and MASTER English with me!!! Happy New Year and BEST wishes to you and your family! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: in broad daylight What happened to Ronny? He got mugged an hour ago in Central Park. In broad daylight?

item.title: 0851 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—cockamamie | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Hello everyone! Can you believe that the END of 2017 is almost here…it’s our last Friday of the year…TGIF! Make it a super weekend! I will be back next year better than ever! And remember, if you want to get serious about your English–please join our classes! Get the free ones first to see what the classes are like AND to see if you like them. Then join us!

item.title: 0850 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to get wind of something | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description A SUPER idiom you can use everywhere! Have a super day and don’t forget our SALE! www.LetsMasterEnglish.com/sale And please tell your friends! The E-cubed PODCAST is UP and READY for YOU!! #LearnEnglish #ESL #LMEtoday Today’s English expression and dialog: to get wind of it Mike’s retiring next month. Yeah. I got wind of it on Twitter. What’d you see? HR announced a new opening in Marketing—so I guessed~ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0849 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—slip through the cracks | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Have a fantastic day!! And learn a great idiom, too! Enjoy today’s podcast! And don’t forget our End Of Year Sale! It’s happening right now at www.LetsMasterEnglish.com/sale CS Today’s English expression and dialog: slip through the cracks How did that guy get so many guns? He slipped through the cracks. But don’t they check people before they can buy a gun? Yes, but the system’s not perfect. Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0848 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to come around | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!! Thank you to EVERYONE who sent me well-wishes for not only Christmas and NYD, but also my birthday! My birthday and Christmas were fantastic! And I will make the rest of 2017 super, too! Today is the day after Christmas! And I’m back!! Today I’ll teach you a PHRASAL VERB–two meanings! Enjoy the lesson. ALSO, today, I will go LIVE on LMEtoday.com AND YouTube and FB and Peri and VK and Twitch!

item.title: 0847 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—in the cards | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s expression is PERFECT for the end of the year. But it could be sad or frustrating for you… BUT, Remember, finish 2017 strong and start 2018 stronger! The E-cubed PODCAST is UP and READY for YOU!! #LearnEnglish #ESL #LMEtoday Have a super week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: in the cards… We’re still working at 7pm~ When I was 20, I planned on retiring at 40.

item.title: 0846 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—I feel less and less so | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description I hope you are doing great this Wednesday–join me LIVE at 1:30pm Chicago, okay? And enjoy today’s podcast NOW!! Share it, please!! Today’s English expression and dialog: I feel less and less so I used to be a really nervous driver. So you became a taxi driver? Well, I feel less and less so now. Whew! That’s good~~ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! Support the Let’s Master English team!

item.title: 0845 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Copy that! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Tuesday, everyone!! Today we have a SUPER expression for today that you can use at home, with friends, at work and at school! Okay? Got it? I hope so!! Today’s English expression and dialog: Copy that! I want you to pick me up by 5pm. Copy that. And don’t forget to bring my briefcase. Roger. Anything else? Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! Support the Let’s Master English team!

item.title: 0844 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Up yours! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday!! Less than three weeks left for 2017! Let’s use that time wisely! Today’s expression is what you might HEAR when two people are arguing…think of the expression as “funny” but try NOT using it! Today’s English expression and dialog: Up yours! And your cooking is terrible. What do you know? And you smell! Up yours! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! Support the Let’s Master English team!

item.title: 0843 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—way off the mark | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!! Thank god it’s Friday!! Congratulations to the southern parts of Texas and northern parts of Mexico–you have SNOW!! I know that it is very rare there!! Enjoy it^^ And enjoy today’s expression, too! It’s really useful!! TGIF! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: way off the mark Coach Shane’s birthday is in two weeks! How old do you think Coach Shane is? Mm…38? Ha! You are way off mark!

item.title: 0842 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Good on you! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today is a nice expression that is probably more popular in Australia than in the US or UK, but we still know it! And so should you! Have a super day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Good on you! Check out my new shirt! Hey, that looks good on you! Thanks. I made it myself. Well, good on you! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0841 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Them’s fightin’ words! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Hello!! We learn a FUNNY expression you can use when someone says something about you that you do NOT like! Enjoy it! And don’t fight!! Today’s Daily Easy English Expression PODCAST is UP and READY for YOU!! #LearnEnglish #ESL Today’s English expression and dialog: Them’s fightin’ words! Why didn’t John come to the party? He said your house was too small. Too small? And your taste in music was bad~ What?

item.title: 0840 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Whatsoever | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today we will master a tricky word from Daily English–it has TWO common usages! Are you ready? Let’s Master English!! Today’s English expression and dialog: Whatsoever Is DDM helping you? I have no doubt whatsoever. Maybe I should join. If you have any questions whatsoever, just ask! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! Support the Let’s Master English team! On PayPal: Send to Or you can go here: PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!

item.title: 0839 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to pigeonhole someone | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s expression is a great word to LEARN–and then a great word to think about. It’s a very strange VERB! Have fun and have a great day! Today’s English expression and dialog: to pigeonhole someone I think I should quit my job. Why? The pay is great. But I’m pigeonholed. So, other than flipping burgers, what can you do? Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0838 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Tell me about it | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday!! Today we will learn a SUPER expression that you can use when you agree with WHAT a person has just said. It’s a SUPER common expression that many ESL students are confused about. After this podcast, you will NOT be confused. I hope!!! If you do get confused, please tell me about it!! Have a GREAT ending to your November! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Tell me about it I’m so happy the summer is over.

item.title: 0837 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to pull the plug | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy BLACK FRIDAY!! It’s that time of year when the focus switches to Christmas and Santa and presents under the Christmas tree!! I LOVE this time of year!! Today I will buy two gifts–one for my mom and one for my neighbor! (maybe more, too!!). What about you? Finding great sales is always fun! And we have a super sale for our memberships, too! If you aren’t a member (actually, most of you are!

item.title: 0836 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a live wire | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thanksgiving!! Thanksgiving is coming up TOMORROW! So, here’s a great expression you might be able to use! If not tomorrow, in the future you will DEFINITELY be able to use it! Be thankful for what we have…that’s the MESSAGE of Thanksgiving. Many people do NOT have much… Helping those in need is the TASK around this holiday. Have a great rest of your week! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: a live wire So, are you excited about Thanksgiving?

item.title: 0835 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—back in my heyday | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thanksgiving Week!! If you’re in the US, please tell us about your plans! Take some pictures! Send them to me and I’ll put them in our newsletter! Use this email: SHANE at GMAIL dot COM, okay?! Our newsletter? You can get that for free at www.LetsMasterEnglish.com/free I love the holidays–one that we often do is “talk about things that happened a long time ago”… And Today’s Expression is PERFECT for this type of conversation!

item.title: 0834 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—beneath contempt | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF! Have a super weekend everyone^^ Don’t forget to check out my new FREE lesson: www.youtube.com/dailydictation Subscribe, learn and SHARE, please!! Today’s English expression and dialog: beneath contempt Bankers are beneath contempt. Come on~ They’re just regular guys. Taking bonuses when their banks lose money? Well…wouldn’t you take free money? Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! Support the Let’s Master English team! On PayPal: Send to Or you can go here: PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!

item.title: 0833 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a double whammy | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s THURSDAY!! A super busy day for me–what about you? In today’s podcast you get ONE great expression that you can use in TWO ways! Listen carefully and you will fully understand! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: A double whammy You don’t look too good. I’ve got a bad cold. I’m taking some medicine. Take some vitamin C, too. Give it a double whammy!

item.title: 0832 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST— ~ is all but ~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description FINALLY! I’ve been SUPER busy the past several days and have NOT been able to find the time to make a podcast…but I’m BACK! And today’s expression is a VERY good one. SUPER common in daily English. Learn it and master it! And if you can, join me today at 3pm Chicago time for LME LIVE on FB, YT, Peri, VK, Twitch and www.LMEtoday.com We’ve got a SUPER dictation assignment, great music AND I will tackle some of your questions!

item.title: 0831 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST— ~ is not all that ~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF! Thank god it’s Friday! One more expression before the weekend for you all~~ Have a wonderful time with your friends and family^^ Your English coach, Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: ~ is not all that ~ Mary is such a genius! Eh~ She’s not all that bright. What? She graduated from Yale. So! So did George Bush. Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0830 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—the trade-off | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s English expression and dialog: the trade-off So, if you work for us, we’ll pay you a lot of money. What’s the trade-off? You will have no time to spend it. Then… Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! Support the Let’s Master English team! On PayPal: Send to Or you can go here: PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!) Study English, FREE ENGLISH LESSONS:

item.title: 0829 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—He has got it bad~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you “have it bad”? Do you know someone who “has it bad”? Tell us–we want to laugh!! Enjoy today’s expression and have a SUPER DAY!! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: He has got it bad~ Where’s John. He quit. WHAT? He’s the star of the team. He’s got it bad, coach. Everything’s about his new girl~ WOMEN!!! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0828 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to be underhanded | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s a COLD morning where I live…can you beat our temperature?! I know some places–like Texas–are HOT! How hot is it today where you live? Today’s expression focuses on an adjective–a word we use to describe people we don’t really like. BUT those people are everywhere…in fact, we’ve all done things that could be described as TODAY’S EXPRESSION! Have a SUPER day, everyone, and look forward to our newsletter tonight!

item.title: 0827 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to milk something | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s the FIRST Monday in November…for me it’s COLD! How cold? Colder than ICE!! How’s your week starting off? Learn a GREAT verb today in our podcast–and DON’T be a victim to someone that “does” that verb!! Okay?^^ Have a super week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to milk something Ever since he was sick, he’s been milking it. But he’s not sick anymore. I know. That was like two months ago.

item.title: 0826 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—at your beck and call | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The weekend is almost here! If you have someone “at your beck and call”–your weekend will be WONDERFUL! And that is today’s expression, LEARN IT and LOVE IT!! But, be nice!! Have a great day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: at your beck and call Can you bring me an ice cube? I’m not at your beck and call. I know, but you were just… Go get it yourself!

item.title: 0825 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—WYSIWYG | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy November!! Do you have any special plans for this month? Tell us! Me? Thanksgiving! Check-ups… CHRISTMAS TREE shopping!! That’s about it. AND…more English lessons for you all^^ Enjoy today’s lesson–COMPUTER PROGRAMMERS will know this expression, but some business people should, too. Everyone else, learn the expression in the second half of the podcast! Have a great day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: WYSIWYG What’s the best type of politician?

item.title: 0824 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—jumped me | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Halloween! Do you believe in ghosts and goblins and headless horsemen and the Great Pumpkin? If you do, then you are probably LOVING today!! Our newsletter goes out tonight–some GREAT Halloween pictures! And it’s also the final day of our OCTOBER Pre-2018 Sale. All that information in the newsletter tonight! Have a super week! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: jumped me How was your hike? Not too good?

item.title: 0837 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Split the difference | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY Monday!! I hope your Monday has started off nicely^^ So far for me–snow! More snow–but only about an inch so far…that’s enough for now! Tomorrow is Halloween–do you celebrate in your country? Also, tomorrow is the END of our PRE-2018 October Sale–did you take advantage of our amazing prices? Questions? Email us at HELP @ LetsMasterEnglish dot COM Okay–back to work for me AND you. Today’s expression is super when you want to “make a compromise” with someone!

item.title: 0822 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—thingamajig | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The PRE-2018 Sale has begin! Hurry–October prices are OVER in less than one week! For more information go to our FaceBook page and/or email us at HELP @ LetsMasterEnglish DOT com And, of course, do NOT forget to listen to today’s excellent podcast in which you will learn two great words! Have a super week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: thingamajig Give me that…thingamajig, will you? What?

item.title: 0821 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—potluck | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s WINDY and COLD where I live on this Tuesday! What about you? Fall is quickly switching to WINTER!! My favorite season^^ We’ve got a great WORD to learn today and I want to hear an answer to my question at the end of the podcast, okay?! Have a SUPER Tuesday, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: potluck What’s that? An apple pie. I’m taking it to Tom’s.

item.title: 0820 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—demanding | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description A NEW week is here–our last FULL week of October! Are you getting excited for the end of the year? You STILL have time to accomplish some of those goals you may have had on January first. It really is NEVER too late to begin. Okay–today’s expression is a WORD which is SUPER useful at work, at home, at school, at the gym…EVERYWHERE! I want you to master this word–listen and master, okay?

item.title: 0819 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—don’t get fresh with me | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF, everyone!! Any plans for the weekend? If you are a PIRF and/or DDM VIP student–join me tomorrow for LIVE classes! It’s going to be a lot of fun helping you master English! Take a picture of what you do this weekend and send it to us–share your life in our newsletter!! Have a great weekend, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: don’t get fresh with me You need to be more positive.

item.title: 0818 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to make up (for) | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Hi everyone! Learning English can be fun…but it can be very frustrating, too. One of the most challenging parts of English to learn…PHRASAL VERBS. If you want to understand and speak “daily English”, you have to master phrasal verbs. We do that in DDM. You should join! Today I will show you four definitions of a very common phrasal verb. In our dialog, I will use three of those definitions.

item.title: 0817 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to offset | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Hello everyone! Happy WEDNESDAY^^ Join me for LME LIVE at 3pm Chicago time, okay? Today’s expression is VERY useful when you have something that is TOO much (too strong, too hot, too expensive, too SOMETHING). Learn it in the podcast and start using it! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to offset Ooh… This apartment is expensive. Yeah, but it’s so huge. And quiet.

item.title: 0816 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to pull the wool over someone’s eyes | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Hello, everyone!! It’s MONDAY…yes^^ I hope you had a nice weekend! I only received pictures from ONE of you–thank you! I would love to get pictures of you and what you do–we share these pictures in our newsletter which goes out tomorrow night! It’s never too late and your pictures are never too boring (usually!!!!)! Well, it’s the start of a new week, so let’s get started with another great English expression–have a super day!

item.title: 0815 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST— ~ gets me every time | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!!! Enjoy today’s expression AND…I’ve given you a challenge. I hope you take on the challenge!! DO IT!!! And also, have a fantastic weekend, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: ~ gets me every time Check out this video! What is it? This lion was raised by these two guys, then they set it free in Africa, and here they are meeting it again after one year. OH MY GOD!

item.title: 0814 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—sticks and stones may break my bones… | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Hello! Happy THURSDAY! Today’s dialog has a very MEAN person with a really MEAN laugh…but Coach Shane is NOT scared at all…check out the dialog and learn an expression that EVERY child who grew up in the USA knows! Have a great day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: sticks and stones may break my bones… Oh my god! Shane—you’re so skinny! And bald!! Let’s call him Baldy Bones!

item.title: 0813 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—haters gonna hate | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Wednesday!! You know, some people HATE and they will never change. Even for me… I absolutely HATE “liver”. Beef liver. Goose liver. Chicken liver. NOPE. No thank you. I don’t like the smell, the taste, the texture…not going to eat it. Regarding people…well, there are a few politicians and celebrities that I HATE~ But I won’t tell you who! We have an expression in modern daily English that describers “people who hate and always will hate”…it’s a good (almost funny) expression.

item.title: 0812 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—takes one to know one | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description How is your Tuesday going so far? Mine…JUST started and it’s going to be a LONG day. More driving, lessons to be made and work in the garden… Ugh~ I need an extra pair of hands…TWO hands on TUEsday are not enough!! Have a SUPER day, Coach Shane PS. Don’t forget, tonight we publish our weekly newsletter. If you don’t have it, you need to sign up: www.LetsMasterEnglish.com/FREE Today’s English expression and dialog: takes one to know one You cook all that food?

item.title: 0811 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to be wired | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s MONDAY…another week~ Make it a great week…how can you do that? If you don’t know how to make THIS week a GREAT week, then start thinking about that…what can you do? Well, for me, to start my Monday morning–I’m drinking some HIGH CAFFEINE coffee! I usually drink decaffeinated coffee, but today is a very important day and I must drive many hours for a very important doctor’s appointment…so I need the caffeine!

item.title: 0810 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—put a crimp in my plan | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s FRIDAY!! The weekend is here…do you have any plans? I hope nothing “TODAY’S EXPRESSION”!!! Enjoy today’s expression and enjoy your weekend! See you on Monday, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: put a crimp in my plan Are you going to take a vacation in December? Well, I was~ What happened? I got sick in July and missed almost two weeks of work~ That put a crimp in my plan~ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0809 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—run of the mill | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description How is your THURSDAY going? For me…it’s just a regular, ordinary, common, typical Thursday. I’ve got my podcast, a new DDM assignment to make and I will make my PIRF lesson videos, too. It’s a “TODAY’S EXPRESSION” day!! But that’s okay for me, because I’m a “TODAY’S EXPRESSION” guy! What about you?!! Have a very nice day, enjoy the podcast and I’ll see you tomorrow! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: run of the mill Where did you grow up?

item.title: 0808 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to pander | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s WEDNESDAY and that means I will be LIVE this afternoon starting around 2:45pm CHICAGO time. LME LIVE will have music and news and I’ll be answering your questions, too. Join us on LMEtoday DOT com, okay?! And if you have any request songs, please put them below–if I can, I’ll play them! AND, of course, don’t forget to listen to Today’s Expression–it’s great, as always!!! See you in a few hours, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to pander Look at the idiots~ Pandering to the general public.

item.title: 0807 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to be pumped | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s TUESDAY…are you READY to go? Ready to work? Ready to study? Ready to be a great mom or dad? Ready to be a great friend? Ready to be a great son or daughter? Are you TODAY’S EXPRESSION? Let’s DO IT!! Today’s expression is great–VERY important. It’s not an expression we can use “every” day, but we should REALLY try. Because if we live every day with Today’s Expression, I guarantee you that YOUR LIFE will be the GREATEST.

item.title: 0806 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Monday-morning quarterback | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s MONDAY…and it’s the beginning of OCTOBER!! I love both…do you?!! The fall, for me, is an EXCELLENT time to get serious about my work–and my work is teaching and coaching English!! What’s your work? Enjoy today’s expression and have a super week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Monday-morning quarterback Did you hear about the accident on the highway? I know…20 people were hurt. The government should have fixed the roads.

item.title: 0805 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a cowlick | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!! I hope you didn’t wake up with a TODAY’S EXPRESSION like I did!! Fortunately, I don’t have to go to an office!! I’ll show you a picture on FB and Twitter of my TODAY’S EXPRESSION!!! Have a super weekend and share pictures of what you are doing, where you are going and what you are eating–send them to me on FB, Twitter or shane@ LetsMasterEnglish DOT com Have a great one!

item.title: 0804 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—rooting for you | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Thursday…the end of the week is almost here AND this is also the end of the month! How has your September been? Mine has been fairly good–I finished two HUGE projects that have been burdening me for months, so I’m happy! Are you doing well? I hope so. I’m TODAY’S EXPRESSION for you!! Enjoy today’s podcast and have a super Thursday! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: rooting for you Tomorrow’s my big interview.

item.title: 0803 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to make a stand | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Can you join me at 3pm Chicago today for LME LIVE? I hope so! It’s free! Just like today’s podcast^^ Do you have STRONG opinions? When I was younger, I didn’t…but I’m not that young anymore~~ And I have noticed that my opinions have become stronger and stronger. In fact, when talking with people, I have started to “TODAY’S EXPRESSION”! What is today’s expression? Check it out^^ Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to make a stand So, how do you feel about illegal immigration?

item.title: 0802 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—beat SMO to it | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s raining and 47 degrees Fahrenheit where I live–what about where you live? And THANK YOU very much to the people who said they were coming to my house to help me move all the firewood, BUT…“today’s expression”!! We have a super expression today–I hope you enjoy it! Have a wonderful Tuesday, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: beat SMO to it I’m SO going to buy that red dress!

item.title: 0801 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST— | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description I’ve missed you!!! I hope you have had a great week. Busy? Me, too!! But, I am VERY happy to be back and starting our podcasts! I don’t know why, but the audio quality is NOT very good…I’ll be working on fixing that! Enjoy the podcast and have a super week! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: give solace to ~ Are they taking those dogs into the hospital?

item.title: 0800 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—pirating...to pirate...pirated | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description 800 E-CUBED PODCASTS!!! And I’ve got a few hundred more to go!! If you want to be REALLY nice…please leave a review in iTunes for me for this podcast! It would help a LOT and I would see it! Leave the reviews in YOUR COUNTRY in YOUR LANGUAGE (and a little English), please!! Thank you! And don’t forget today’s expression, too! I have been guilty of it…but not anymore!

item.title: 0799 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—bring in the big guns | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s WEDNESDAY–that means we have LME LIVE today at 3pm Chicago. If you received my newsletter yesterday, you already have the vocabulary list so it should be an easy story!! I hope to see you then! BUT…before that, let’s master an American idiom!! It sounds violent, but it’s NOT!! Have a SUPER day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: bring in the big guns How do you pronounce this word?

item.title: 0798 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—tough as nails | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy TUESDAY! I’m off to a slow start today because of a headache~ Ugh~~ I’ve had it for about three days now and it’s driving me CRAZY~!! Any advice?! Anyway, we’ve got a great expression today–I wish I were “this expression”!! Have a great (pain-free) day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: tough as nails Is Jim going to the gym? Yeah. Wasn’t he in a car accident last week?

item.title: 0797 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—take up (time) VS take up (SMT) | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s MONDAY…let’s make this a GREAT week. Regarding today’s podcast–think about what “TAKES UP” your time. Also, think about “TAKING UP” something new. Two phrasal verbs for you!! Have a SUPER week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: take up (time) VS take up (SMT) Shane! I never see you anymore! Yeah, my free time is completely taken up~ With what? I took up gardening~ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0796 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—take up with VS take SMT up with SMO | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF! For most of us, right? But let’s take a minute to send a prayer (and HELP if you can) to Mexico, the Caribbean and other places wrought with Mother Nature’s power these days… You get a DOUBLE lesson today–I hope you enjoy it! Have a super weekend, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: take up with VS take SMT up with Why are you taking up with those guys?

item.title: 0795 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Go big or go home~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description If you are going to do something…DO IT 100%, right? 110%!! And that’s what today’s expression means–GO FOR THE GOLD! Go for victory! Go for an A. Go for the best job! Go for the best life!!! Enjoy the lesson and I’ll see you tomorrow! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Go big or go home~ How’s your team this year? They’re really tough. I’m excited. Think you’ll make it to the championship?

item.title: 0794 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—the proof is in the pudding | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Wednesday…that means we have an LME LIVE show at 3pm Chicago! Can you join me? I hope so! If you can’t, you can still learn a great expression–check out today’s podcast and have a fantastic day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: the proof is in the pudding (the proof of the pudding is in the eating) I’ve been taking Coach Shane’s course for a year now.

item.title: 0793 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—I’m sitting on it~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Hello everyone!! I hope your Tuesday is going terrifically!! Mine just started. I’ve got a HUGELY BUSY day…must stay focused!! Enjoy the podcast and I’ll talk to you tomorrow! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: I’m sitting on it (idea) I thought you wanted to start that new project. I’m sitting on it. Why? It’s such a good idea! Well, it’s too early. Maybe in six months. Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0792 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—You know what they say~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description What is the VERY COMMON expression/saying that we use every Friday in the USA? Do you use it in your country? When we study English, what is the very common expression/saying that we use to EMPHASIZE “practice” what you learn? If we want to be healthy, in the US, we often recommend eating apples. Because…well, there is a common SAYING/EXPRESSION that we use! Learn what those sayings/expressions are AND learn a new expression/saying to refer to them!

item.title: 0791 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Can’t make head nor tail~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Hi everyone!! I hope your week has been nice…it is ALMOST over!! Time to plan for the weekend!! Today’s expression is perfect for the situation when: Someone explains something, but you STILL do not understand. You look at something…but you don’t know what it is. You read the instructions on how to do something…but you STILL don’t understand… What is today’s expression? Listen and find out!! I’ll give you the “proper” expression AND the “daily English expression”!

item.title: 0790 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to sweep something under the rug | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Wednesday–join me LIVE at 3pm Chicago if you can! We’ll have a news story, Q&A and even some music! Check out this podcast to find out HOW to join me. And, of course, it’s all free!! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to sweep something under the rug I can’t believe Don is getting married. Again! Number 5. And his fiancé doesn’t know.

item.title: 0789 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—the powers that be | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Who REALLY controls the government? The governmentS? The world? The world economy? The wars…the peace? Well…I will tell you WHO that is in today’s podcast! Please pray for my safety! Have a SAFE day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: the powers that be Do you think Trump could become president? I doubt it! Why not? The powers that be wouldn’t allow it! They want someone they can control.

item.title: 0788 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—sort as a VERB, NOUN and ADV | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday!! Question: Which do you think is more important in your English studies? A. Learning new vocabulary B. Mastering easy vocabular C. Seeing and using English words “in action” I’ll give you MY answer at the end of this podcast! Have a SUPER week, Coach Shane PS. To those struggling in Texas and elsewhere, my thoughts are with you and I hope the misery ends quickly. Today’s English expression and dialog: sort as a VERB, NOUN and ADV Did you sort out the candies?

item.title: 0787 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—beach, sheet and fork (pronunciation warning~) | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!! This is the last FULL WEEKEND of August 2017. Any special plans? Me? WORK!! I have a full day of work on Saturday…on Sunday, I should probably stack firewood. Can you help me?!! Today’s podcast will focus on the “dangerous” pronunciation of three words. If you say them wrong–they might sound like BAD WORDS. Pronunciation is very important!! Enjoy the podcast and have a super weekend^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: beach, sheet and fork (pronunciation warning~) Let’s go to the beach!

item.title: 0786 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—through as an ADV, PREP and ADJ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Thursday…ugh! Many people do NOT like Thursdays. Well, today I will give you one more reason to NOT like Thursdays…grammar!! YAY!!! I’m going to explain three common usages of the word “through”–as a preposition, an adverb and an adjective. HOPEFULLY you will have a good feeling for THROUGH after the podcast is…through! Have a super day, Smile! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: through as an ADV, PREP and ADJ Through the front door…I’m home!

item.title: 0785 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Aw, shucks~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s the MIDDLE of the week…are you surviving? I hope so!! Today’s expression is great to use WHEN someone gives you a nice compliment! It’s an older expression, BUT if you say it correctly, people will love it! I know you can do it–just repeat after me!! Will you join me today at 3pm Chicago time? I will be LIVE on YouTube, Facebook and Periscope. Hopefully I’ll be live on VK.

item.title: 0784 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST— | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Tuesday!! I hope you are all doing great^^ Today we will learn a GREAT phrase we use to describe regular guys and girls. Are you regular? Are you irregular?!! Me? I’m just a regular guy! Have a SUPER day and I’ll talk to you tomorrow^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: an average Joe / a plain Jane How did Ryan become so powerful? It’s a mystery.

item.title: 0783 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Golly! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today is a Total Solar Eclipse in the USA. Some parts of the USA will experience TOTAL darkness because the moon will completely block out the sun!! Where I live, IT’S CLOUDY!!!!! But I still hope it gets really dark…maybe I will go LIVE and share the eclipse with you guys… Would that be cool? FOLLOW me on FB and Twitter for updates!! AND, then, together, we can use Today’s Expression!

item.title: 0782 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—see a man about a horse | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s FRIDAY!! I hope you have a wonderful night and a fantastic weekend? Special plans? Well, if your plans included going to a pub for a beer–than ABSOLUTELY you will be able to use today’s expression. Actually, to use today’s expression does NOT require beer…but beer helps!! Enjoy the lesson^^ TGIF, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: see a man about a horse (dog) Oh no. Here comes Peter.

item.title: 0781 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—highbrow | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Hello! I hope your Thursday is off to a nice start^^ Today we will learn two words–the words are very good to know. The words are used in a negative connotation, even though one of the words means “intellectual”!! Have a SUPER day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: highbrow Look! My new Steven Pinker book! You are so highbrow! What are you reading? Pink…who? The Pink Panther.

item.title: 0780 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—corporate material | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you work for a big company? Do you think, one day in the future, that you will be at the top of the company? I hope so! YOU need today’s expression! And keep up the great work!! Have a super Wednesday. If you have time, join me at 3pm Chicago for a LIVE session on FB and YT. For updates, follow me on Twitter (@coachshane) See you soon!

item.title: 0779 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—for the lowest common denominator | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Tuesday! Today’s expression is a bit tough–but you WILL hear it/read it. It is actually not a very “nice” expression (usually). It’s commonly used in a way to “criticize” or “belittle” something/someone. Learn it, but you don’t have to use it! Have a SUPER day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: for the lowest common denominator What are you doing? Checking out the magazines. They’re for the lowest common denominator~ Hello?

item.title: 0778 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—raise the roof | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY MONDAY! Have a SUPER week. Raise the roof! And share the BEST of you!! Coach Shane PS. Enjoy today’s expression, too!! Today’s English expression and dialog: raise the roof Are you ready to raise the roof? Yeah! This concert is gonna be great! Here’s a song you all might know~ Sing it!! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!

item.title: 0777 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—You know your ~Greeks~! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF! Thank god it’s Friday! I hope you have a fantastic weekend. I will have LIVE hangouts with my PIRF and DDM students on Saturday…and on Sunday I might go fishing!! YAY!! What about you? And SEE if you can use today’s expression in a sentence–I’m sure that you will be able to! Have a GREAT weekend, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: You know your Greeks~ Who said “We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak?

item.title: 0776 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—more than one way to skin a cat | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s THURSDAY…the week is almost over! I hope it has been a good week for you^^ Today’s expression is a bit gruesome…but people DO use it…so I want you to know it. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED! Have a super day and I’ll see you tomorrow^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: more than one way to skin a cat I want you to study, go to college and get a good job.

item.title: 0775 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to have a chip on your shoulder | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s WEDNESDAY! I’ve got a great expression for you today. Also, don’t forget, we’ll be LIVE on YouTube and Facebook at 3pm Chicago time today. We have a NEWS story and I’ll answer a few of your questions, too! Have a SUPER day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to have a chip on your shoulder You going to Chuck’s party? No. It’s gonna be fun. Nope. You still have a chip on your shoulder~ He’s not nice to me and he thinks he’s so great.

item.title: 0774 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—painstaking | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Tuesday!! SOME of our work is pretty easy. But sometimes we have tasks that require a LOT of concentration. The task is complex, it’s complicated. There are many things that need to be perfect. Hmm…relationships can be like that, too, right?!! Well, today I’ll give you a word that PERFECTLY describes those tasks. I want you to USE that word today! Have a super Tuesday, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: painstaking Ugh~ Doing this dictation is painstaking.

item.title: 0773 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—take it in stride | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy MONDAY!!! If something OR someone is making you mad today, is stressing you out today, is driving you crazy…REMEMBER Today’s Expression! Have a SUPER Monday, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: take it in stride I got another complaint today. You can’t make everyone happy. But… Hey! Don’t worry. Take it in stride! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!

item.title: 0772 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Murphy’s Law | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!! Thank god it’s Friday!! Do you have special plans? TAKE PICTURES and send them to me so I can add them to our weekly newsletter: shane AT LetsMasterEnglsih DOT com! Today’s Expression is PERFECT for when you have a plan AND SOMETHING GOES WRONG!!!! Have a “wrong-free” weekend! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Murphy’s Law Should I switch lanes? Don’t. I’m gonna. There. We should start moving faster.

item.title: 0771 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to get owned (pwn/pwnd) | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s expression is REALLY common in Daily English–especially during competitions and arguments! I’m guessing that you might not have many chances to USE the expression, but if you pay attention, you are go to SEE and HEAR the expression a lot! You’ll learn TWO VERSIONS. The first version is the “spoken” version which is most common; the second is the internet version which is also spoken (but not as much as the first version).

item.title: 077 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a big plus | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description I really like today’s expression–and you will, too. PLEASE make some examples and send them to me!! If you put them on FB or Twitter, then I will see them today!! It’s WEDNESDAY–can you join me at 3pm Chicago for LME LIVE? We will have a news story for you. You can build listening comprehension AND vocabulary. Today’s story is great. AND IT IS FREE!!! No other English teacher or coach out there like me.

item.title: 0769 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to have no call to ~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY AUGUST!! What’s happening this month for you? School? Vacation? A business trip? Nothing? For me…nothing really. Maybe I’ll be able to harvest some things in my garden? I hope so!! I wish my chickens would lay some eggs…I’m hungry!! Today’s expression is TOUGH to use, but I want you to know it SO IF you hear it, you’ll recognize it! Have a SUPER month, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to have no call to do ~ You told my wife I went mountain climbing?

item.title: 0768 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST--a cinch | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy MONDAY!! Isn’t it NICE when you do something that for you is REALLY easy, but for other people it’s not so easy!! You feel good, right? Well, today I will give you a word that you can use in this situation! Have a SUPER week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: a cinch How do you edit your videos? I use Sony Vegas. I heard it’s complicated.

item.title: 0767 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—dead on | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s FRIDAY! Do you have any special plans for the weekend? If so, take some pictures and send them to me–I give you my email address at the end of today’s expression. Today’s expression is EXCELLENT for when you want to tell someone that they are “100% accurate”! They are SUPER PRECISE. When you use this expression, the person will feel good and they will like you and probably give you lots of money and love and make you powerful and happy… Maybe not.

item.title: 0766 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a dad bod | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Guys (and ladies who have a guy), today’s expression is especially for you! It’s a great expression…and most of you can probably use it. I can! Have a FANTASTIC day, everyone! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: a dad bod I see you’re developing a belly. I’m working on my dad bod. Dad bod? Not too fit, not too fat. A body perfect for a dad! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0765 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to dish out | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today we will learn a phrasal verb and TWO of its most common usages. Phrasal verbs are VERY essential if you want to master Daily English. I highly recommend you join DDM if you want to really improve your knowledge, understanding and usage of phrasal verbs!! Have a SUPER day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to dish out distribute… Sue is mad at me. Why? I told her she needed to slow down on the perfume.

item.title: 0764 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—take the high road | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description LAST DAY for our DDM VIP sale! ddm @ letsmasterenglish DOT com! Today’s expression is an important one… Sometimes people make us REALLY mad. They lie, they cheat, they don’t do their job…there are MANY ways people can make us mad! BUT…how do we respond? That’s the tough part. Today’s expression offers ONE WAY to respond! Enjoy the podcast–it’s a little long (sorry!) and have a FANTASTIC day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: take the high road Bob made me so mad.

item.title: 0763 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—crabby | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes we are JUST in a bad mood. We are not happy for…NO reason~ And because of that, we are sometimes not very nice. We are rude or we yell or we complain… By why? Being around a person when they feel like that is NOT fun. Sometimes moms can feel that way, bosses, kids, friends… How can we describe such a person? I’ll teach you today! BE HAPPY…the weekend is almost here!

item.title: 0762 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Chance for/Chance to/Chance of | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s WEDNESDAY…the middle of the week for most of us~ I’ve got a busy day–my busy days start on Wednesdays and end on Saturdays. I’m not too excited about today! However, at 1pm I have a LIVE class with my ActionEnglish students–that’s good; and at 3pm I have LME LIVE on FB and YT–that’s good, too. It’s the other work that requires my FULL concentration…exhausting!! How about your Wednesday plans?

item.title: 0761 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST— my BFAM or my SFAM | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s TUESDAY! So, I will teach you TWO great expressions. You can use these expressions when talking about someone who is SO MUCH “your best friend”! SO close, it’s as though they were part of your family…even your sibling!! It’s a great expression to use among friends and family^^ Have a wonderful day AND don’t forget Stage Two of our DDM VIP sale. Stage Two ends on Thursday, for more info email DDM @ letsmasterenglish DOT com Your English coach, Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: my brother from another mother/my sister from another mister You’re what?

item.title: 0760 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to have blinders on | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday!! So, since last week I have been having BIG audio problems. Why? Well, I’m in the process of upgrading my audio system so I can do our Internet Radio show LIVE (www.LMEtoday.com). And I needed a new component…WHICH IS CAUSING ME PROBLEMS!! Anyway, I have gone back to the old set-up for a few audio prodcasts!! It’s nice to be back with good audio!! Have a SUPER day and enjoy today’s podcast which is about having BLINDERS on!

item.title: 0759 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—touch base | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s THE WEEKEND!! Do you have special plans? If you go someplace nice or eat something delicious, please send a picture!! shane@letsmasterenglish DOT com I would love to see AND I will share it in our next newsletter! Our newsletter? Get it free: www.letsmasterenglish.com/free Oh, and we are having a sale on DDM VIP now. It’s a SUPER chance to join–email us for more information: ddm@letsmasterenglish DOT com And, of course, enjoy today’s expression!

item.title: 0758 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to lose touch with OR lose contact with | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Over the years…for most people, we start many new relationships. New friends, new coworkers, new neighbors. And the old friends and coworkers and neighbors…they start to disappear from our lives~ For me that has happened–what about you? We have a great expression that you can use which tells people that you USED TO BE close, but not anymore. But you are NOT enemies, either!! Right?! Have a super day, Your English coach forever, Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Oh, you got email from Eric.

item.title: 0757 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—RSVP (as a verb!) | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s TUESDAY^^ I hope your Tuesday is wonderful–I’ll be driving a LOT today so I’ll have to drink a LOT of coffee~ Do you like to drive? I actually love it!! Enjoy today’s podcast and have a super Tuesday! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: e, please. Shane Peterson. S-O-N. Nope. I don’t see you here. But I’m family. Did you RSVP? For my mom’s birthday party?! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0756 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—have at it | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description MONDAY!!! Yes^^ Okay, be sure to master today’s expression, because you’ll be able to use it IMMEDIATELY!! Even with your non-English speaking friends (you will sound so smart!). Seriously! And for those of you interested in joining DDM VIP…we have an AMAZING offer right now. If you’re interested, email us: ddm AT letsmasterenglish.com Don’t miss this chance! Have a super week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: have at it I can’t do this.

item.title: 0755 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to horse around | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!! I hope you are HAPPY for the weekend^^ Do you have any special plans? I would LOVE to see your pictures of what you do and where you go and what you eat! If you don’t mind, I would like to share some of them in our newsletter!! Send me your pictures: shane@letsmasterenglish DOT com Today’s expression is perfect for the weekend!! Listen and enjoy^^ Have a SUPER weekend!

item.title: 0754 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—jealousy vs envy | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Are you jealous…or are you envious? Hmm…do you know the difference? Even Americans get confused about how to explain the difference, but Coach Shane is a special American and he’ll help you understand!! Jealousy and envy are quite similar, but jealousy includes an extra meaning that envy does NOT! And that difference will be EASY to understand if you listen to today’s podcast!! Have an EXCELLENT day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: jealousy vs envy I’m jealous of you.

item.title: 0753 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—no-nonsense | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s the MIDDLE of the week…a tough time for a lot of people. But hey, we know the expression: WORK HARD, PLAY HARD, right? I believe in that. When I work–boom, I work. I focus. I get stuff done. And when work is finished–I COMPLETELY do NOT work! I do MY thing! That is my definition of “work hard, play hard”. Today’s expression is perfect for when you “work hard”!

item.title: 0752 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—What do you got? (X3) | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Independence Day, USA!!! It’s the USA’s birthday! I’m very proud–my family took part in the Revolutionary War that began 241 years ago! Today we celebrate with delicious food and fireworks!! But…why not study a little English, too?! Today I have three expressions that mean the same thing–one of them is “really American” and one of them is “really proper”! Enjoy the lesson, enjoy the day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: What do you got?

item.title: 0751 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Rats! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s English expression and dialog: Rats! Rats! What’s wrong? I forgot to buy butter. Ugh~ Let’s turn around. Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!) Study English, FREE ENGLISH LESSONS, on our YouTube channels: Support the Let’s Master English team! On PayPal: Send to Or you can go here: Today’s Daily Easy English Expression PODCAST is UP and READY for YOU!

item.title: 0750 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—no traffic/tons of traffic | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!! I hope you have a wonderful weekend! Do you have tons of plans? I have no plans~ Sometimes in daily spoken English, native speakers BREAK the grammar rules…and that’s okay! Today, I will teach you one of those “broken” expressions! You’ll be able to use it JUST LIKE an American! (if you want!!) Have a great weekend, Coach Shane PS–if you are Polish or Brazilian–you can start DDM free!

item.title: 0749 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to rattle someone | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description If someone scares you OR makes you nervous, then you can use today’s expression! Sometimes our WIFE/HUSBAND or our BOSS or our TEACHER or the NEWS (TV/newspaper) can scare us or make us nervous…but, if you are like me, NOTHING makes me nervous. Nothing scares me. Do you believe that?!! Have a super day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to rattle someone Hey, Shane, I need to talk.

item.title: 0748 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—It don’t mean jack~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s podcast is a phrase that means “worthless” or “nothing”. This expression is VERY useful–but it IS a “casual” expression, so I wouldn’t use it in a formal setting! Have a FANTASTIC Wednesday, everyone! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: It don’t mean jack~ I promise I won’t do it again. Promises, promises. Really. This time I mean it. Your promises don’t mean jack anymore. Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0747 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—bald bald, good good | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today we have an EXCELLENT expression you can use to EMPHASIZE something–and it is REALLY easy so you will have NO problem remembering it. It is EASY. Easy! And that’s what I love trying to do–make mastering English fun and easy!! Have a fantastic day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: bald bald, good good Oh! I’m full~ What about apple pie? Sure! But you’re full~ Well, not full full!

item.title: 0746 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—24/7 (INTONATION!) | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Is there a city in the world that does NOT have stores that are open CONSTANTLY? 24 hours a day, seven days a week, 365 days a year. No holidays…always open. VERY convenient, right? But…now that I have moved to the country, no more of that!! If I want to go to a big supermarket at 3am, I will have to drive almost 45 minutes. If I want a McDonald’s hamburger at 3 am, I will have to drive two hours!

item.title: 0745 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—the silver bullet | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s FRIDAY!! I hope that you have an excellent day and weekend! Do you have any special plans? It will be raining where I live, so I’ll be stuck at home…I guess I’ll read! And sleep! And ride my bike on my indoor trainer~!! Today’s expression is EXCELLENT–you can find an example if you think for a minute or two. I would love to see your example–leave a comment!

item.title: 0744 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—chronic pain | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Work hard, play hard. Right? Yeah, that is how MANY of us live…but let me tell you: be careful with that “play hard”!! One day, all that “hard” will come back to you! As I near 50 years on this Earth–my youthful days of running and playing team sports have come back… NOT as enjoyment, but as pain!! When you are young, the pain you experience exercising usually goes away quickly, but as you get older…it never goes away!

item.title: 0743 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—say something out in the open | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Some things should be said “in private”. But some things can be said “in public”! What things are okay? Enjoy today’s podcast and have a SUPER Wednesday! Your English coach, Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: say something out in the open Hi! You wanna have some coffee? Ugh! Your breath stinks! What? Oh…sorry… Betty! You shouldn’t say something like that right out in the open! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0742 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to put the kibosh on something | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes there are plans that MUST BE STOPPED. Sometimes there are people who MUST BE STOPPED!! In that case, there is an expression that you can use to emphasize that they MUST BE STOPPED!! I will teach you that great expression in today’s podcast. And for a little assignment; I want to hear from you: what plans MUST BE STOPPED? What people MUST BE STOPPED?!! Have a wonderful day!

item.title: 0741 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—alls I need is… | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description A NEW workweek is here…ugh~!! Well, I hope you find joy…SOME joy in your work! I’m pretty lucky–I get to work with you on your English!! Today we have an expression–one version is for your LISTENING COMPREHENSION, the other version (without the S) is for your speaking! It’s a SUPER useful expression and is VERY common! Have a wonderful week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: alls I need is… What do you need to be happy?

item.title: 0740 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—for my own good | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description IT’S FRIDAY!! TGIF~~ Do you have plans for this weekend? Saturday is a busy day for me–lots of LIVE classes with my PIRF and DDM students. It’s a LOT of fun so I don’t mind working on the weekend! Sunday…more gardening! I hope to have everything planted this weekend~ AND…it’s Father’s Day! Happy Father’s Day to all of the dads out there. I will have a special radio show on LMEtoday.

item.title: 0739 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—sheer | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today we learn a word you should use when something is: pure 100% complete absolute Donald Trump’s hair is pure perfection. The new Bugatti is 100% speed. That man shows complete professionalism. For me, teaching is an absolute pleasure. The word you will learn is PERFECT!! And it will make you sound sophisticated! Intelligent…and I do this for you for free!! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: sheer You look SO happy!

item.title: 0738 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—pesky | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description MOSQUITOES…I hate them. I had one in my house last night. I saw him and tried to kill him but he was too fast~ Fortunately, he didn’t bite me last night. Maybe he got my cats! Actually, they say that MALE mosquitoes don’t bite, only the female ones~~ Women~!!! Back to the mosquito–imagine one buzzing near your ear…do you like that sound? NO!!! And today I will teach you the perfect adjective to use when talking about mosquitoes AND other “bothersome” but “small” things!

item.title: 0737 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to spruce up | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description My office at home is nice. But…it might look a little boring. The walls (not my choice!) are painted a light yellow and there is nothing on the walls except a calendar. SO, I decided to “TODAY’S EXPRESSION”. When I was a kid and I bought my first car, I wanted my car to be special–to look better and cool. SO, I “TODAY’S EXPRESSIONed” my car! When your resume looks good BUT still doesn’t seem to “shine” or “get attention”, you might consider “TODAY’S EXPRESSIONing” your resume!

item.title: 0736 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—on so many levels | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description MONDAY!! I hope your week is starting off nicely! Did you check out our new LMEtoday.com radio show? Do you like it? I would LOVE to hear from you!! Contact me on www.twitter.com/coachshane or www.facebook.com/ESLCoachShane Okay, today’s expression is a great phrase when you want to tell someone: I like A for MANY different reasons. I hate A for MANY different reasons. A is difficult for MANY different reasons.

item.title: 0735 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to side with someone | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description FRIDAY is here!! This weekend I will START my garden! What about you–do you have any special plans? I would love to hear about them–leave a comment! Have a GREAT weekend and don’t forget to listen to my podcast!! You’ll learn a very good expression–it might save your job!! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to side with someone The boss thought Peter’s idea was stupid. It wasn’t bad.

item.title: 0734 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to rile somebody up | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s THURSDAY!! Is it a busy day for you? Make it a good day, okay? Coach Shane~!! Today’s English expression and dialog: to rile somebody up What are you doing? Rubbing Minty’s tummy. You’re gonna rile her up~ But she’s such a cutie! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!) Study English, FREE ENGLISH LESSONS, on our YouTube channels: Support the Let’s Master English team!

item.title: 0733 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—the wherewithal | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description If you want to achieve GREAT success, you NEED today’s expression. Today’s expression is a WORD that has a very important meaning…actually, it can have several meanings: money knowledge ability talent energy perseverance Some of those words might seem similar, but they are all really different. For success…which is more important? Well, that’s not easy to answer, right? So, by using today’s expression you can answer it! BE strong today!

item.title: 0732 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a bunny boiler | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description There is a very famous line: Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned. Which means that if a woman is made very angry, she can be MUCH more dangerous than hell! Yeah…that may be true. But, I don’t want to find out EITHER way!! But there is that “stereotype” – women can be REALLY mean if a relationship doesn’t go well. And today, I’ve got an expression that means exactly that.

item.title: 0731 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to get the EDGE on SMO | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description LIFE can be very competitive. We compete for grades. We compete for jobs. We compete for positions. We compete for love. We compete for attention. We compete ALMOST everywhere. I think that is good. We need to keep going–to keep improving–to keep our eye on something in the future. A brighter day, a happier tomorrow, a more successful future. And in today’s podcast, you will learn an EXCELLENT expression to use when YOU are competing–GOOD LUCK!

item.title: 0730 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Go for it! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!! If you want to have a good, fulfilling life, you NEED to try new things. That doesn’t mean difficult…try to learn something, try to go somewhere, try to read something different… AND we need today’s expression when we try those things! Have a super weekend and DON’T forget–DDM VIP is on Sale now–join us and start Mastering your English! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: go for it There’s a new job opening at school.

item.title: 0729 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to quibble over | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday!! You know, for many of us, the work week is ALMOST done…we are getting tired, the stress is high…it is EASY to get into small arguments and fights~ SO, today I will teach you a great phrasal verb you can use like this… Hey!! Let’s stop “arguing about” this. Instead of “arguing about”, a perfect phrasal verb that has the extra nuance of “arguing about something really small and unimportant”!

item.title: 0728 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to dole out | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description LMEtoday.COM is UP! Please check out our new English Radio Show! We will have great music, news, Q&A, song explanations–and most importantly, your letters, requests and dedications! Please go to LMEtoday.COM and check it out! And today’s Ecubed podcast is ready, too! Yesterday we learned about the word “dole” and we learned that its nuance was negative. BUT, today, I will teach you a phrasal verb with DOLE and its nuance is positive!

item.title: 0727 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—on the dole | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s TUESDAY! I hope you have a fantastic day! Work hard and play hard! Enjoy today’s podcast and I’ll talk to you tomorrow^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: on the dole How do these people do this? Do what? Demonstrate! Everyday!! They’re on the dole~ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!) Study English, FREE ENGLISH LESSONS, on our YouTube channels: Support the Let’s Master English team!

item.title: 0726 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to fly the coop | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
