item.description: Podcast Description If your boss or your teacher or your parents or your wife/husband TRIES TO KEEP YOU IN ONE PLACE…UGH!!! If they try to “imprison” you…do you like it? No, many of us do NOT like that. So, our natural instinct is to ESCAPE!! And today’s expression will teach you a great expression which means escape! Have a SUPER day! And don’t escape~~ Your English coach, Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to fly the coop Where’s Shane?

item.title: 0725 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—taken for a ride | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s FRIDAY!! I hope that you have a super weekend! I hope you do NOT become a victim of cheating/deceitful people! Today we have an expression that deals with that subject–it’s a GREAT expression!! Have a super weekend–love your family–and ENJOY!! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: taken for a ride Back already? Yeah~ Did you enjoy the Skywalk? No! I think I was taken for a ride!

item.title: 0724 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—duke it out | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you like to fight? With your fists? If yes, then today’s expression is perfect for you! However, most people don’t like to fight with their fists! Right? We prefer…guns!!! NO! I’m joking~ Violent fighting is scary to a lot of people–but we still hear about it all the time. So…today’s expression is good! Don’t get into any fights today! Coach Shane PS. Don’t forget the amazing DDM VIP sale happening quietly right now–here’s the link to sign up: https://www.

item.title: 0723 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—If it looks like a duck... | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Deductive reasoning…something we ALL do everyday. Even as babies! What it is? I’ll explain in the podcast AND I’ll give you a SUPER expression you can use instead of the technical-sounding “deductive reasoning”! Have a SUPER day and don’t forget: 1. Free LIVE classes today on YouTube/Facebook at 3pm Chicago 2. Sale on DDM VIP coming next week but here’s a secret link if you sign up NOW: 3.

item.title: 0722 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to get worked up about ~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description What kinds of things get you UPSET…BOTHERED…ANGRY? I give a little list of things that make me mad in today’s podcast AND I give a great phrase to use when you become upset or bothered or angry. Be strong, today. Keep your family members close. Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to get worked up about ~ What are you so worked up about? Timmy said my English was bad.

item.title: 0721 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—denial ain’t just a river in Egypt | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy MONDAY!!! Today’s expression is related to last week’s “in denial”. In the US, we have a joke that combines “in denial” with “in the Nile”. It’s funny. To me. I hope I do a good job explaining the joke~ I tried!! Have a SUPER day and tomorrow I’ll give you an easier expression! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: denial ain’t just a river in Egypt Let’s go see Michael’s baby!

item.title: 0720 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—in denial | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF! Have a SUPER weekend, everyone! If you are one of my students, I will see you in DDM ELITE today, DDM VIP tomorrow and PIRF LIVE tomorrow!! It’s gonna be an English-filled weekend! If you’re not in my classes…why not?!! Join us! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: in denial Did you see John? His shirt? It’s too small! Did you see his rolls? Oh my god!

item.title: 0719 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—rolls | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s word is…scary. One meaning of the word is wonderful–delicious. But, the other meaning…terrible. And somehow, these two words are connected. If you get too much of the delicious meaning, we end up with the terrible meaning. Check out the podcast and BE CAREFUL!! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: rolls No dinner roll? No thanks. I’ve got my own rolls. Oh, stop that!

item.title: 0718 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—dumbstruck | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes people say things that are SO shocking or amazing or stupid!! And in those situations, we open our mouths to say something…but NOTHING comes out! In this expression, we have a word–a perfect word! It’s Wednesday–have a SUPER day!! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: dumbstruck What was wrong yesterday? I was totally dumbstruck after talking with my mom. What did she say? She said that we’re…aliens~ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0717 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—spoiler-alert | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description I love American football and I look forward to watching the games when I have a break. That means I usually don’t get the chance to watch the games LIVE. SO, I’m VERY careful NOT to read the newspaper or check the news on the internet OR talk to my friends BEFORE I watch the game because I know there will be information–I don’t want to know!! I want to watch the game “as if it were LIVE”!

item.title: 0716 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to be DENSE | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description MOST of you, I know, have a VERY high IQ. You are very smart. You probably know much more than the people who do not know me. We, my friends, are damn smart. But…because we are so smart, we also know that there are a few things that we do NOT know much about. In fact, we may even be … stupid~!! And today, I will teach you the perfect word to describe your or HIS or MY or HER level of stupidity!

item.title: 0715 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Can you back it up? | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!! I hope that you have a nice weekend…mine will be FULL of FISHING! I really hope I catch a nice fish~~ If I do, I will take a picture and put it in our weekly newsletter! I promise!! Many times people SAY things…but they have no PROOF of what they say is true. So, often, we want them to give us the proof–give us the FACTS or SUPPORTING EVIDENCE of what they say.

item.title: 0714 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—bragging rights | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Have you done something that is REALLY good? All of us have something. Maybe you can throw a ball the farthest…run the fastest…type the fastest…speak English the best among your friends… Find your “specialty” and THEN BRAG!!! Now, usually, bragging is NOT a good thing, but in today’s podcast you will see that SOMETIMES it is okay!! Check it out^^ Have a SUPER day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: bragging rights That guy thinks he’s so special.

item.title: 0713 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—What’s the rush? | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy TUESDAY!! Today’s expression is…perhaps better for Thursdays. For sure, it is good for the weekend… You tell me, when do YOU like to use this expression? Have a SUPER day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: What’s the rush? Hey! Eat up! What’s the rush? We open up at 8! We gotta clean up this place. It’s clean enough! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0712 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—He who smelt it dealt it. | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description WARNING. Today’s expression is NOT for the ladies. Well, not for most ladies. Today’s expression is for the men…well, most men. It’s Monday, usually people don’t really like Mondays, but for many of you, I have a great expression that will make you laugh…smile…or cry~ I’m not sure which. It’s a VERY SERIOUS expression and the expression is FACT. The expression is based on HUMAN EXISTENCE. If you are a human, you must acknowledge the brilliance of this expression–embrace this expression and FREELY use this expression.

item.title: 0711 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—wait up | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The weekend is HERE!! Have a lovely, safe weekend. And if you are going to be with your friends, you might need today’s expression!! See you next week! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: wait up I’m leaving. Wait up! Hurry up! I’m almost ready. I waited 5 minutes already. Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!

item.title: 0710 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—I do like…I do need…WHY do? | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today you will learn a VERY excellent trick to either: 1. emphasize your verb 2. tell the other person you are talking with that his ASSUMPTION is wrong. And this trick requires ONE, SIMPLE word! Check out the podcast and have a SUPER day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: I do like…I do need…WHY do? Are you on Amazon again? I do like this new Sony TV.

item.title: 0709 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a closet fan | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Deep inside our hearts…deep inside our minds…we sometimes enjoy things that we would NEVER tell ANYONE. It’s a secret. It’s personal. It’s…embarrassing. I’ll give you an example…when I’m with my friends, I’m a normal guy. I listen to normal music. As a “normal guy”, Celine Dion is NOT normal music–Quiet Riot would be normal. As a “normal guy”, Titanic is NOT a normal movie–Die Hard is a normal movie.

item.title: 0708 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—leeway | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description SOME people NEED freedom, others create TOO MANY problems with freedom! What type of person are you? Me…I’m a combination. With no freedom I go crazy and get in trouble…with too much freedom my productivity can actually be low. I need a balance. So, since I work from home, I do my best to maintain a strict schedule of working hours–but I do give myself a little freedom! FREEDOM…we need to UPGRADE that word!

item.title: 0707 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a knack...the knack | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you have a special talent–a special skill? Are you very good at something. Then you will LOVE today’s expression. I have “a …” for cooking. I am getting “the …” of raising chickens. I do NOT have “a …” for math. What do YOU have “a …” for? Leave a message and have a SUPER week! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: a knack…the knack Your paintings are really nice.

item.title: 0706 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—hubris | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s FRIDAY!! For me, the weekend will begin very soon! Do you have any plans? I do!! IF the snow melts, I will continue cleaning out an area so I can plant a vegetable garden. Also, I plan on going fishing for the first time!! I wish I had a boat, but anyway, I’ll be able to find some places to fish^^ I’ll take pictures and put them in my newsletter (if I remember).

item.title: 0705 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a ruse | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today we learn a good word–ruse. I’ll give you a few great examples, both positive and negative. I highly recommend you use Google and find other examples in the news. Have a SUPER Thursday! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: a ruse How are you going to surprise him? I don’t know. He’s ALWAYS in his room. We need to think of a ruse to get him out… Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0704 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Kirk, out! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s already the middle of the week–I hope your week is going nicely! Mine is good–today we got SNOW! At the end of April!! I love it…but I wouldn’t mind some nicer weather so I can go fishing!! Today we have a fun expression that you should, like yesterday, only use with your friends!! It’s not a mean expression, it’s just very casual!! Have a super Wednesday, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Kirk, out.

item.title: 0703 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—shoot | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today we have a GREAT expression that you can use in casual moments when someone wants to ask you a question or when someone want to ask you to do a favor! I don’t recommend using it at Customs & Immigration, to the police or even your boss! But with friends and family, with close co-workers, fellow students–NO problem! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: shoot Can I ask a question?

item.title: 0702 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—moo juice | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday!! Today I’ll teach you a new, funny “expression” that you can use when you want to drink or buy or order MILK!! Yes!! Milk can be funny^^ Trust me…well, it can be funny in English!! Have a SUPER week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: moo juice You want some juice with your breakfast? Yeah, moo juice, please. Sorry, no milk. Eh… I’m good, then. Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0701 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—I'm good! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s FRIDAY! TGIF!! Actually, I have a busy day on Saturday, too…so SUNDAY will be my day of rest! Many people enjoy the weekend by going out to restaurants and bars! And at those places, you will interact with waiters and waitresses, right? And one question those people always ask their customers: Would you like something more? or Would you like some more? or Would you like another ~?

item.title: 0700 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—my plate's full | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you like going to BUFFET restaurants? You know, those restaurants where you pay one price and can go back and get more and then go back and get more and more and more?!! My favorite buffet is a BEER buffet!!! Well, today we have an expression that is KIND OF related to the buffet–but we use it when we are REALLY BUSY! It’s a great expression. Today is Thursday and “Today’s Expression” is perfect for me!

item.title: 0699 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—zilch | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description WOW…699. This is the Ecubed podcast 699. Tomorrow is a big day! And, in fact, today is a big day in DDM–we start 401!!! So many BEGINNINGS this week! If you are NOT a DDM member, you need to join. And if you join DDM VIP or DDM LITE Mondays TODAY, you can get at 60% Discount on your first month! Email us at DDM at LetsMasterEnglish.com Today’s expression is great.

item.title: 0698 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—piecemeal | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s FRIDAY!! If you celebrate Easter–Happy Easter Sunday! Otherwise–ENJOY the weekend just the same!! Today’s we will learn a word that is common in the news. It’s one of those “academic” words (TOEFL, IELTS, RESEARCH…) words that LOOKS tough but is actually REALLY simple. And I will make it easy^^ Have a SUPER weekend everyone–don’t forget, Monday, April 17th is the last day for our DDM VIP special and DDM LITE Monday special.

item.title: 0697 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to lose one's bearings | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s expression focuses on an expression that means “not knowing where you are”–it’s very useful! If you don’t know where you are in your English studies, follow me! I’ll help you!!! Did you know we have a super opportunity to join DDM VIP and DDM LITE Mondays right now? The offer is over on Monday–join us! Send an email to DDM @ LetsMasterEnglish DOT com Have a great day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to lose one’s bearings So, did you talk to Mike?

item.title: 0696 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a bleak future | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Dark and hopeless and full of worry…oh, those words are NOT good. But for some people, that’s how they see their future… NO. If you are one of those people, you have to understand that YOU are able to direct your future. And if your future can be helped by mastering English, I am here!! Today’s expression is a word that we need to KILL!! But, still, from time to time, it’s a very useful word^^ Have a HOPE-FILLED day, work hard, and together Let’s Master English!

item.title: 0695 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Things that make you go hmm… | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Some questions…we JUST don’t know the answer to. Even though the question does NOT seem that difficult… Would vegetarians eat gummy worms or animal crackers? Why does the convenience store, which is opened 24 hours a day, have door locks? If you try to fail and then succeed…what have you done? The questions are silly…but they’re still good questions! Can you think of any? Enjoy today’s podcast! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Things that make you go hmm… Why does round pizza come in a square box?

item.title: 0694 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to get chunky | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday! Today’s Expression comes to you because of a question from one of our listeners! I REALLY appreciate your feedback and support–it means a lot to me. Sometimes I wonder…am I just making a podcast and no one is learning anything…and then I cry!! I’m okay~ But I love to hear from you^^ Have a SUPER WEEK! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to get chunky What are you doing?

item.title: 0693 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to weasel out of something | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!! Thank god it’s Friday!! Don’t you HATE it when you and a few people agree to do something together, and then when you start ONE guy suddenly leaves because of some reason that you DO NOT believe?!! Well, today’s expression is to describe what THAT GUY is doing!! But…let’s be honest…we’ve all done that!!! Have a SUPER weekend! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to weasel out of sth Where were you yesterday?

item.title: 0692 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—go to bat for someone | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description They say a person can really feel happy IF they help another person “for free”!! I think that’s true–for most people!! Well, today’s expression is kind of that like. Sometimes the people around us NEED some help in order to get something–a new job, a good project, a chance to go somewhere–and WE have the power to possible help that person. Just recently one of my students asked me to recommend him to a university in the UK.

item.title: 0691 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—come to terms with | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description A lot of people study a language–English–and they learn a lot…but they get to a point where the learning almost stops. Some people struggle for more, some people give up. The listening doesn’t improve. There are always TOO MANY new words and phrases. Pronunciation seems to get MORE difficult. Well, you need to “TODAY’S EXPRESSION” your ability and understand you might need help! I studied the Korean language by myself for about three years and Korean people were really amazed at my ability…but my ability did NOT improve after that.

item.title: 0690 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—walk it off | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description I missed you!!! When you get HIT in the head…the arm…the leg. When you bump your elbow…your knee…your shin…your toe~ OW!!! It really hurts. But…do you call the ambulance? NO! Not if you’re a real man! You “Today’s Expression”! Be tough! Make it a TOUGH week! Have a great one and HAPPY APRIL, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: walk it off OW!!! My leg!!! Quit crying! It was just a baseball.

item.title: 0689 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—my foot…my *ss…my butt | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s expression…well, be careful! I’m giving you three WAYS to say the same thing…one of the ways uses a “bad” word. I prefer you use the “foot” version!!! But more than using the expression, you will probably HEAR the expression or READ the expression much more. And it is a GREAT expression. When someone says something that YOU do NOT believe…we use this expression! Have a SUPER day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: my foot…my *ss…my butt Coach Shane is almost finished.

item.title: 0688 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—~ is dogging me | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description My leg…my boss…this cold…my mom…my wife… They ALL have one thing in common. They often BOTHER me! And I have a SUPER verb that you can use to describe when THOSE THINGS bother you!! Have a SUPER week and I hope no one bothers you^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: ~ is dogging me Did you work out today? No. My leg’s dogging me. Oh, that’s too bad.

item.title: 0687 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a jock | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description So, yesterday we learned about DOUGHBOY! Are you a doughboy? Be honest!! Today we learn the OPPOSITE of a doughboy. It’s a good word–I’m working had to be TODAY’S EXPRESSION! Join me! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: a jock You’re all sweaty! Yeah, just finished my ride. And you were swimming this morning? Yeah. I love working out. Wow~ I didn’t know you were a jock!

item.title: 0686 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—doughboy | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description When I was young, I was in GOOD shape. I didn’t have HUGE muscles, but I was strong and thin and fast. I was a triathlete. Then…I slowly…got bigger and more and more unhealthy. Now I’m getting old SO I have decided to work on my health. And the number one priority–GETTING RID of my fat. I have extra weight around my tummy…I am a TODAY’S EXPRESSION! Today we learn a fun word–we USUALLY use it as a joke, but remember, some people might NOT like the word.

item.title: 0685 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a handful | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Some people, some groups of people, some animals…are HARD to control sometimes. Right? There are children who listen VERY well to their teachers, and there are children who will NEVER listen to their teachers! Not only people, groups of people and animals, but some tasks can be really difficult to manage/control/direct, too! And today you will learn the perfect word to use if you want to describe those situations and those people!

item.title: 0684 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a drag | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s the weekend…I hope you are able to have a NICE time!! When things are BORING, it’s not very nice. When things are boring AND bothersome, it is really not nice! To describe something boring and bothersome, we have a GREAT word–and that’s what you will learn today. TGIF! Have a great weekend–I’ll be back next week^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: a drag Are you okay?

item.title: 0683 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—tight | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description If you have a GREAT team or group, you need today’s word. If you have a GREAT relationship with someone, you need today’s word. It’s a casual expression that means YOU ARE CLOSE! Very good friends. Excellent teammates. The BEST!!! Have a super day–tomorrow is FRIDAY!! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: tight Wow! I saw you talking to that guy. Besher? Oh, yeah. We’re tight. But he’s such a famous genius!

item.title: 0682 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a scatterbrain | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes when we have SO many things to do we FORGET what we NEED to do. This can cause problems. Do you ever suffer from this problem? Most people do!! Have a CALM and ORGANIZED day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: scatterbrain Did you send out the lessons? What lessons? The free lessons you promised! Oh~ I’m such a scatterbrain! I’ll do it~ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0681 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—~ doesn’t cut it | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description A GREAT expression today–one we all need. But one we would NOT like to hear. When something OR someone is NOT good enough–we can use this expression. Master it–I’ll help you! Have a fantastic day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: ~ doesn’t cut it So, how are these curtains? Nope. They don’t cut it. Why? They’re too thin and too short. Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0680 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—hit me up | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s English expression and dialog: hit me up If you want free English lessons, hit me up. Really? What kinds of lessons? Two—speaking and listening. Great! I’ll email you today^^ Happy MONDAY!! Today’s expression is excellent for a Monday. For any day, really! If you want to show how EXCELLENT you are, you can use today’s expression. You are excellent, right? Then you need today’s expression!!! No pressure! Have a SUPER week^^ Coach Shane PS.

item.title: 0679 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—flimsy | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description AFTER I made today’s podcast something happened. I was wearing a watch that I bought a few years ago–it was really cheap, but I liked it. I took the watch off and as I was taking it off, the strap BROKE! I was angry for about one minute–but then I realized–hey, it was cheap~!! I’ll just get a new strap! The watch strap was TODAY’S EXPRESSION! It’s a great expression–a word that you need to know^^ TGIF, have a super weekend, JOIN DDM before Monday and let’s start off next week FRESH!

item.title: 0678 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a bug zapper | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s STILL the winter for me…but I’m fearful of the summer. Not because of the heat. Not because of tornadoes. Because of…SKEETERS. Oh, they can be SO nasty. And where I live, in the country, they can be the size of BIRDS!! WHAT is a skeeter? I’ll tell you in this podcast. And I will also tell you what you can use to KILL skeeters!! Enjoy the winter, everyone, we are safe from skeeters!

item.title: 0677 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—roots | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description We learn a VERY important word today–I think it’s important. But, I guess, when you are between the ages of 15 and 35, you might disagree. What is this word? Why does it become more important the older you get? Well, listen and find out! And if you disagree–I’d love to hear from you!! Have a super day, everyone, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: roots You like the area?

item.title: 0676 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Raise your glass... | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Most of you know the expression “Cheers!” right? We put our drinks (glasses) together and say CHEERS and then have a drink. We do that at parties and celebrations, right? Well…you NEED to know what comes BEFORE “Cheers!” And that’s what you will learn today! Have a SUPER day! And if you are celebrating something–let me know! See you! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: raise your glass Do you want friends around the world?

item.title: 0675 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to LABEL someone~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today we learn a GREAT word that you NEED to think about. It’s a word that we will NOT be able to avoid, but we NEED to understand the power of the word. It can be VERY powerful. It can be very good, but more often, it can be very bad. Be careful! And have a SUPER week!! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to LABEL someone~ Look at your flags!

item.title: 0674 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—when the rooster crows | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The WEEKEND is here for most of us! What are you plans? Do you wake up earlier on your OFF days? Do you wake up later? Same time? Today’s expression is about waking up early…you know the expression “the early bird gets the worm”, right? Well, today we learn something different. But it’s just as useful–and at the end, I give you something to think about! Don’t forget, on Sunday, I will have the Super Sunday Sale–a special price on one of my classes that is ONLY available on Facebook ON Sunday.

item.title: 0673 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—one step forward, two steps back | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description When we TRY something difficult–MANY times it feels like we improve a little bit…but then we realize that we have MORE problems. We have a great expression for this situation. We use the expression at the office, at school and in our relationships. You will master this expression if you listen to today’s podcast. AND, IMPORTANTLY…after the dialog, I will tell you a very important secret–a secret that I learned.

item.title: 0672 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—iffy | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s English expression and dialog: iffy You coming over Friday? It’s iffy. Why? Work? No. Football. How big’s your TV? Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!) Study English, FREE ENGLISH LESSONS, on our YouTube channels: Support the Let’s Master English team! On PayPal: Send to Or you can go here: Today’s Daily Easy English Expression PODCAST is UP and READY for YOU!

item.title: 0671 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to iron out (plus pronunciation of iron!) | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description A DOUBLE lesson on this Monday!! Hi, everyone^^ I hope you had a nice weekend and that your week is starting off great. Today–two things. A phrasal verb that is SUPER useful at work AND at home. PLUS, a great pronunciation point. Have a great week, everyone^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to iron out (plus pronunciation of iron!) Are you busy this afternoon? No, why? Let’s iron out a few things, okay?

item.title: 0670 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—this VS that VS it | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes the SIMPLEST words can be confusing…you know WHEN to use THIS or THAT or IT, right? Well, if you are unsure, check out the podcast–I’ll make it easy for you! Have a super weekend, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: this VS that VS it Daddy! What’s this animal? It’s a baby koala bear. And that animal? That’s a baby kangaroo! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0669 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Still~~~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Hi everyone! Today’s podcast features a word that is OVERUSED in American English…but it sometimes causes confusion in ESL students. It’s really simple–so hopefully you won’t be confused in the future!! Have a super week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Still~~~! Telemarketers are such a pain. Still, you should be polite. But they’re rude. STILL! At least say goodbye! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0668 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—telemarketers | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description There are many BAD jobs in the world, right? Maybe you have a bad job… BUT, the worst job, in my opinion, is a job that NOT ONLY you hate, BUT ALSO other people hate you for your job!! Can you imagine going to work and trying to work with people who do NOT want to talk to you?! I feel sorry for those people…but I still don’t like them!

item.title: 0667 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—swing and a miss | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Did you ever try to do something–you really tried really hard–but you failed? Maybe you tried a course at school… Maybe you tried to get a job somewhere… Maybe you tried to cook something special… Maybe you tried to get a date with a woman you liked… BUT you failed. Me? I failed at each of those. And today’s podcast will give you a GREAT expression you can use in each of those situations.

item.title: 0666 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to throw a temper tantrum | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description WOW…today’s podcast number is SCARY!! We just talked about numbers like that in last week’s LET’S MASTER ENGLISH podcast–did you listen to it? It’s a great podcast–very different to this one! Anyway, today’s expression is PERFECT if you want to describe badly misbehaving children…but it can be used for adults, too! Check it out and have a LOVELY day! Your English coach, Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to throw a temper tantrum Where’s your daughter?

item.title: 0665 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—soulmate | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s word is VERY important to everyone…but it’s a personal word. You might use the word when you introduce your wife/girlfriend/husband/boyfriend. And it’s POSSIBLE to use it in other relationships, but it’s best to use when you are referring to the person you LOVE. The person you want to spend the rest of your life with. We’re three weeks from Valentine’s Day…if you have TODAY’S EXPRESSION, start thinking of something special to do!

item.title: 0664 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to be full of himself | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you like it when movie stars and singers tell you their POLITICAL thoughts? Personally, I do NOT like it. I don’t care if I agree with them OR disagree, I don’t want to hear about their opinions!! I know, MANY, MANY people disagree with me! That’s okay~ But for me, I like “stars” because of their ability to perform. But hey…we are ALL guilty of telling other people our opinions even though other people did not ASK!

item.title: 0663 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to be filled with confidence | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description One of my GOALS in helping you all with your English–making you CONFIDENT. Building your confidence is very important when learning anything–we need to be confident. Don’t be STUPID! But find your weaknesses, let me help you with them and THAT WAY you can build your confidence! Right? Yes!! Let’s master English–I really mean it! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to be filled with confidence I need a haircut.

item.title: 0662 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—an invigorating sleep | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description FEELING good is SUCH a great feeling! You can do everything better when you REALLY feel good. And today’s expression will teach you a great adjective you can use on those MORNINGS when you really feel good!! I hope tomorrow morning you wake up FULL OF ENERGY! Have a great day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: an invigorating sleep You look really good! Yeah! Invigorating sleep is the key!

item.title: 0661 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to break someone | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Can I break you? Or is your WILL strong? Can I break you? Or can you keep a secret from me? Can I break you? Or are your habits too strong? Can I break you? Or are your emotions too strong? Sometimes we want to break someone, but it can be VERY tough. Has anyone ever broken you? Check out the podcast! Have a great day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to break someone You never smile.

item.title: 0660 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to draw a blank | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you have a lot of ideas? If someone asks you to help them solve a problem–are you good? Are you creative? If your wife asks you something like–“Honey, if you could change something about me, what would you change?” Are you able to give her an answer? Are you able to think of things that you could tell her to change? In both situations, many times we are UNABLE to THINK of ANYTHING!

item.title: 0659 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to lose sleep over something | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It is TIME TO START!! Let’s get back to having fun while learning English! I will do my best for the FUN part, you have to do your best on the LEARNING part, okay? Have a super 2017^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to lose sleep over something You look really stressed. Jack’s having a New Year’s Eve party. No invitation~ Eh~ That’s nothing to lose sleep over.

item.title: 2016 FINAL Podcast for Daily Easy English Expression | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Short and simple: Happy New Year!! I hope 2017 is a super year for you all. I’ll be here for your English needs, okay?! Together Let’s master English! Coach Shane Transcript

item.title: 0658 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a living legend | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF! And thank you all for the wonderful Birthday wishes!! I had a very nice birthday! Okay, down to business~ Here’s a list of names…how many do you know? Oprah Winfrey Richard Branson Jack Ma Wynton Marsalis Michael Jordan Warren Buffett Bill Gates All of these people have several things in common–ONE of them I will teach you today! Enjoy the podcast and HAVE yourself a MERRY little CHRISTMAS!

item.title: 0657 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a knuckle dragger | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s expression is a silly one–but SOMETIMES it can be a little mean…so try not to use it! But you will hear it and read it–and it’s usually said as a joke. Today…IS MY BIRTHDAY! So, I tried to make the podcast a little funny at the end…I hope you laugh! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: a knuckle dragger Why don’t you want to date Brian?

item.title: 0656 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—I have a condition | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description I was hiking yesterday and I met a guy on the trail. As we chatted, I offered him a Christmas cookie! He was very happy and said, “Sure! But, it doesn’t have any nuts, does it?” I told him it had almonds. He was suddenly disappointed and said, “Oh, darn. I’d love to have one, but I have a c…” And that is today’s expression! Have a SUPER week everyone!

item.title: 0655 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—…period | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description When someone KEEPS asking you about something or KEEPS asking you to do something and you say NO and again NO and again NO! You want to tell the person that you do NOT want to talk about that topic again EVER…what expression can you use? Well, I’ll give you a useful expression. And I’ll focus on what we say in America, but I’ll also tell you what they say in the UK!

item.title: 0654 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a knee-slapper | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Are you going somewhere for Christmas? For the end of the year? For the upcoming holidays? Well, I have a friend who ALWAYS prepares a new joke to tell his family during the holidays. He works on it and then tells it to his family and they ALWAYS laugh!! A lot! Today, I will tell you exactly HOW MUCH they laughed. It’s a great expression. And…I want YOU to tell me a joke so that I laugh as much as my friend’s family…good luck.

item.title: 0653 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to nosh | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s the HOLIDAY season!! And everywhere you go–there are delicious things! Candies, cookies, pies and cakes. Turkeys and hams and all the veggies are on sale at the supermarkets! Nuts and fruits, cheeses and sausages and all kinds of crackers! OH YEAH!! So, you’ve eaten breakfast, you’ve eaten lunch, you’ve eaten dinner…but still, between those meals, after those meals, before those meals–you want to EAT a little of something–what verb can you use?

item.title: 0652 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST— ~ saved the day | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description A GREAT expression that you can use today…find a situation where you THOUGHT something was not going to be good…but then something unexpected came along and everything was okay!! Example… I was cooking dinner–steak! It was going to be romantic. BUT, just as I was about to start cooking, the electricity went out!! Then I remembered, “I have a barbecue grill!” My grill saved the day…and some romance, too!

item.title: 0651 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Whatever floats your boat + | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today we have two funny expressions that Americans like because they SOUND funny! The meaning is good, too! Have a super Thursday–the weekend is almost HERE!!! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: whatever floats your boat (flips your switch) Can you take me to the shopping mall? Sure. No, wait! Take me to Walmart instead. Whatever floats your boat^^ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0650 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—I can’t thank you enough! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Well, how many times did you say, “Thank you!” today? I try to use it a lot–and I mean it, too. But sometimes people REALLY do something nice–they really do more than necessary. In those cases, “Thank you!” just doesn’t seem…enough! So, I have the perfect expression for you for those situations!! I hope your December is going wonderfully! Your English coach, Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: I can’t thank you enough!

item.title: 0649 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to badger someone | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s the END of the year…we need to be nice to people. But with the end of the year, people get STRESSED! And we become more sensitive. Especially when people TODAY’S EXPRESSION us. Check out today’s expression, learn it, use it, and then…let’s TRY and not be so stressed! It’s the most wonderful time of the year^^ Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0648 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to kick start | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description How do you REALLY get your day started? How about after lunch–what do you do to GET your energy level BACK UP? What about when you go to a party–what do you do to GET your “party level” UP? In these situations (and many more!!) we have a verb that is PERFECT. That’s what you will learn in today’s podcast. I use the verb every day! 2017 is coming up…you can use this verb then, too!

item.title: 0647 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—peddling | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you like selling? Most people do NOT like selling. Most people do NOT like salespeople. But…that is not good. We ALL have to sell EVERYDAY. Moms sell their ideas to kids–eat your carrots, they’re good for your eyes. Don’t sit too close to the TV or you’ll need glasses. Employees sell their ideas to their bosses/companies–If we changed the color of the design more people might be interested in it.

item.title: 0646 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—second to none | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s expression YOU NEED TO USE. Especially at this time of the year–the end of the year, many holidays, FAMILY time. This is SUCH an excellent expression. I’m not joking–USE it today. And then use it again and again! It will make YOU feel good and your listener feel even better!! I hope! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: second to none What’s that?

item.title: 0645 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—in the limelight | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you like ROCK music? I do! One of my favorite songs (and I have MANY favorite songs!!) is a song by Rush called Limelight. Wow!! EXCELLENT. And in today’s expression, I will explain “limelight” and give you an excellent expression to use, too! At your company, do you “like to be in the limelight”? What about at home? Among your friends? At a party? Be honest! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: in the limelight You’re such a good singer!

item.title: 0644 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to hang in the balance | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Monday!! I like Mondays…sorry^^ Today’s expression is really good–when you are waiting for someone else to make a decision for you but people ask you what you are going to do… For example: I want to go on a date with Sue. I sent her a text: “Would you like to go to the movies with me on Friday night?” However, so far, no answer. Then my friend asks me, “Hey, Shane!

item.title: 0643 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—smack-dab in the middle of | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY THANKSGIVING!!!! Please listen to my Thanksgiving message to you all–I mean it from the bottom of my heart! THANK YOU! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: smack-dab in the middle Why are you covering your face? I got a new zit. Who cares! It’s smack-dab in the middle of my nose! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!

item.title: 0642 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—tenacity | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you have any experience with SUCCESS? Think about what kinds of successes you have had. Make a short list. They can be simple successes or great successes. After you make a list, FIND a similarity. There might be many–focus, concentration, luck, practice, love, passion, enthusiasm, knowledge, experience… Now, there is one thing I did not write–and it is REALLY common for the “big successes”. You’ll find that word in today’s expression!

item.title: 0641 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—an auspicious day | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today, Wednesday, November 9…11/9…2016, is a VERY special day in the US. It is not only the “reverse” of 9/11, it is the day that the “government as normal” cycle has been interrupted by the election of a non-politician as US president. Whether you like him or not, it doesn’t matter. It is NEW territory for the US–and it will have an impact on the US’s international relations. It is TODAY’S EXPRESSION!

item.title: 0640 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to be above reproach/beyond reproach | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It is ELECTION DAY in the USA. Who will the US citizens choose…a big question. But, one thing is NOT a question…both candidates have LOTS of “bad qualities”. You might say he has more than her or she has more than him…but I hope we can agree that both are “not that innocent”! Today’s expression covers that–it’s a great one! Have a great day and if you’re an American citizen–VOTE!

item.title: 0639 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to get my own way | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In my house, I am number one. I’m the boss. I’m king. Except when my cats are hungry. Or when my lady wants anything. Then, I’m a servant. I’m a slave. I’m in second…or third…I’m in last place. Today’s expression is for the person who is KING (or queen). The person who ALWAYS controls the situation. Is that you? Is that your friend? Do you like that person?!!! Enjoy the podcast and I’ll see you tomorrow^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to get my own way What do you want for dinner?

item.title: 0638 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—out of it | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Tuesday…it’s November…I know there are many people who are feeling great (like me), but many who are feeling…not great!! For those people, you can use today’s expression! When you are feeling ill, depressed, not enthusiastic, numb…you need to use today’s expression AND then you need to laugh a little with me! Have a SUPER day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: out of it Where’ve you been?

item.title: 0637 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—I owe it all to… | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you know the expression “because of you”? It’s good, but in a POSITIVE situation, there’s a better expression–>“thanks to you”. And, there is even a BETTER expression that is REALLY nice and I will teach you that today! Great, huh? See if you can use it to someone! Have a fantastic LAST day of October, a fantastic Halloween, a fantastic week and I’ll see you tomorrow!! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: I owe it all to… You are looking good today!

item.title: 0636 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a loud tie | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes you will see a person at the office or at school or on the street who is wearing clothes or a hat or shoes or something that SEEMS to be SHOUTING AT YOU!! It is saying, “HEY! Look at me!! Look at my bright colors!!” We have a word for these types of clothes–do you have any? I do!! I’ll tell you what in my podcast! It’s FRIDAY!

item.title: 0635 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a reflective strip | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s expression focuses on a WORD…you might think it’s not necessary, but it could be really useful. For your safety or for your family. And anyway, it’s ALWAYS good to learn new vocabulary! So check out the dialog, too! Have a wonderful day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: reflective strip Whoa!! A little bright, don’t you think? I’m going for a bike ride. I need to be seen.

item.title: 0634 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—earthy colors | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description When I lived in the desert of Nevada in the Southwestern US, it was beautiful…but…there was a HUGE lack of color. All the colors blended together. NOT ugly…but no variety. The same is similar where I live in Chicago–but it’s quite different. Today’s expression will help you classify a group of colors–browns, yellows, oranges…greens, some grayish-blues–colors that you see in your natural environment! In most cases, they are beautiful colors, but not colors you really want to wear!

item.title: 0633 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—bacon (more than just meat) | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description My neighbor is a strict vegetarian. She eats NO meat. But…daily, she brings home the bacon. She loves bacon. Can she still be a vegetarian and bring home the bacon? YES!! And I explain how in today’s podcast! Enjoy it! And bring home some bacon^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: bacon What’s that smell? I’m making bacon. It’s not breakfast! It’s for my video. I’m making bacon to make the bacon.

item.title: 0632 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to leave your mark | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday! Many of us, after we die, want people to have a GOOD memory of us. Some of us want people to remember how GREAT we were! What about you? How do you plan on “TODAY’S EXPRESSION”? Have you started? I have!! I’ll tell you in today’s podcast! Have a SUPER WEEK! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: leave my mark I’m leaving my mark on this rock.

item.title: 0631 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—inscribe VS subscribe | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!! Today’s expression is easy…but some people get CONFUSED. Hopefully after you listen to the dialog, you will remember! I hope you have a wonderful weekend with your family and friends! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: inscribe VS subscribe Did you inscribe to Coach Shane? Where? On the internet. His YouTube channel. You mean SUBSCRIBE! Yes^^ Inscribe, subscribe! What’s the difference?! This… Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0630 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—They SOUND THE SAME: What are you doing/What do you mean? | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today I will show you something VERY interesting about English–it’s information that’s good to know and GREAT to USE!! Have a super day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: They SOUND THE SAME: What are you doing/What do you mean? What are you doing? I’m making you happy! By typing on the computer? What do you mean? I’m buying your birthday present^^ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0629 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to go/be AWOL | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description When you expect someone to BE at a certain place at a certain time…but they aren’t there. You call them…no answer. You ask other people…no one knows anything. What can you say? Well, you might say many bad words! But today I have a better word to use! Have a super day and KEEP YOUR APPOINTMENTS!!! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: He went AWOL!! Uh…where’s Pavel? He should be here.

item.title: 0628 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—I misspoke! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description I remember a few times when I was speaking Korean and BECAUSE my pronunciation was a little wrong I said a word that was REALLY BAD!! It was VERY embarrassing. And sometimes when you don’t FULLY UNDERSTAND the meaning of a word, you might USE it wrong! Well, in that situation, you NEED today’s expression in today’s podcast! Be careful today!! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: I misspoke!

item.title: 0627 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Don’t knock it ‘til you try it! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description SO many times we “decide” if we like something BEFORE we really know! It might be a food or a drink or a person, right? We do that with singers and actors and with books. With books we have an expression–Don’t judge a book by its cover! Have you heard that expression? It’s a good one. Well, we have another expression that you can use for ALL the other ones, too!

item.title: 0626 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—chitchat VS shoot the breeze | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description So, I’m a guy and I usually DON’T talk that much. I’m pretty quiet. When I do talk, it’s about fishing, politics…and nature. Really. I’m quite boring. So, the question is…when I “talk” with my friends, am I “chitchatting” or “shooting the breeze”? I’ll explain BOTH of these AND I will give you a possible difference! Have a SUPER weekend, everyone! TGIF Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: chitchat VS shoot the breeze Where were you?

item.title: 0625 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to be on the level with SMO | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In business, in politics and in our personal relationships, we ALL want our partners to be “Today’s Expression”. Are you “Today’s Expression”?!! It’s a super expression! I hope you have a super day^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to be on the level with SMO You voted for him? I thought you liked the other guy. I did, but I just don’t think he’s on the level with the public.

item.title: 0624 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—eat like a bird | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description When you eat, do you eat a LOT or just a little? I eat twice a day, so I generally eat a lot. I really should eat three times a day… I have heard that eating several small meals a day is actually more healthy~ Anyway, today’s expression describes people who only eat small amounts! If you know one of those people, then you can use this expression! My mom is one of these people!

item.title: 0623 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to put a dent into SMT | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you have a BIG and BUSY work schedule this week? I hope on Monday and Tuesday you were able to “GET A LOT DONE/FINISHED”. Instead of “get a lot done/finished”, I have an excellent expression for you! Mastering today’s expression will be helpful as you conquer English!! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to put a dent into SOMETHING I made this cake for my mom yesterday, but she didn’t even put a dent into it.

item.title: 0622 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—use your noggin | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s expression CAN have two meanings–but they’re really similar. Unless you are like the guy in the dialog…you NEED to be careful or you could hurt yourself. That’s my job–teaching you English so you don’t hurt yourself!! Have a SUPER week! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: use your noggin How can crack open this walnut? Use your noggin! Oh, okay. OW!! NO!! Use your brains, silly! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0621 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—pull your weight | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s been TOO LONG!! I’ll explain where I have been, then you can learn a great new expression!! Have a great week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: pull your weight This is a group project, so you all need to pull your weight. Can we pick our partners? Nope. I’ll assign you. Oh…please don’t put me with John~ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0620 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a rain check | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Baseball season is almost over in the US–it finishes in October. Baseball is one of the most popular sports in the US and it has given us many great “English expressions” that we use in everyday life! Today, I will teach you one of those expressions! It’s super useful so I hope you learn how to use it yourself! Have a fantastic week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: a rain check Wanna go to the baseball game tonight with me?

item.title: 0619 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Get the vote out! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In November, the US has its big presidential election. When are elections in your country? Do you participate? Many people say, “My vote doesn’t matter.” Do you agree with that? Hmm…you need TODAY’S EXPRESSION. Enjoy it AND TGIF!! Have a great weekend! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Get the vote out. Did you vote? No. Why not? Get the vote out! It doesn’t matter. Yes, it does!

item.title: 0618 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—What a joke~~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description When something is STUPID or NOT FUNNY or RIDICULOUS or FRUSTRATING…we can use an expression which might surprise you! Enjoy today’s podcast and have a SUPER Thursday! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: What a joke~ What a joke. What? President Obama’s Press Secretary’s name is Josh Earnest. Yeah, so? Josh—to lie. Earnest—very serious. So…he’s a serious liar. Yeah~ What a joke! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0617 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—earnest | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The most important thing WE can do, is to try our best. And to “really try our best” is today’s expression–our word of the day. As a coach, as a student, as a business person, as a leader, as a family man, as a son…there are SO many areas where we need to be TODAY’S EXPRESSION. Are you TODAY’S EXPRESSION? Have a super day! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: earnest What’s so funny?

item.title: 0616 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST— to josh | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you like teasing your friends? Do you like joking? Do you like saying something that is NOT REALLY TRUE but you only say it to see your friend’s reaction–then you tell them the truth?!! If you do, then you need TODAY’S EXPRESSION! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to josh Coach Shane received Halloween candy last year! What? Are you joshing me? No.

item.title: 0615 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—quarantine (noun and verb) | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s MONDAY! I hope you are feeling okay~ If not, you may need to TODAY’S EXPRESSION~!! Today we have a word that we can use as a noun and a verb…and it’s a serious word. We usually use it in emergencies, but import/export people also need to be familiar with it!! Have a SUPER week! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: quarantine (noun and verb) What do you think about quarantining people?

item.title: 0614 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—skip the middleman | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description One of the GREAT advantages that the internet provides us–TODAY’S EXPRESSION! You can study with me WITHOUT having to go to a school! You can buy products DIRECTLY from the manufacturer! This allows us to save time, money, gas…it’s really wonderful! Learn Today’s Expression and see how it can benefit you!! Have a great day and TGIF!! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: skip the middleman Nice cup.

item.title: 0613 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—dinner and a movie | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Many people want to learn English…and many of those people hope one day to, maybe, go on a date with a native English speaking person!! You? Well, today I will give you an expression you can use to ask someone out on a date. Remember, the words I teach are important, but HOW I teach is also very important–listen carefully and good luck! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: dinner and a movie It’s been really nice talking to you.

item.title: 0612 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a show of hands | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description When you have a group of people and you want to QUICKLY know what the think/what they want/how they feel about something…what is a SUPER EASY expression to use? I will teach you today! If you ever give a presentation–even a speech–today’s expression will KEEP YOUR AUDIENCE engrossed! That’s what you want!! Have a super day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: a show of hands With a show of hands, how many of you like English?

item.title: 0611 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—old-timer | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In today’s podcast you will learn a GREAT noun to describe someone old–very old. OR…to describe someone with a LOT of experience in something. You don’t have to be “old” to be “today’s expression”! I’m sure you have a lot of experience in something, right? Tell us how YOU can use Today’s Expression! Have a great day, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: old-timer When did you start teaching on YouTube?

item.title: 0610 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST— | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description A few days ago we learned about “freeloaders”! Are you a freeloader?!! Well, today you will learn a phrasal verb that PERFECTLY describes what freeloaders do! I want you to think of a time when you DID THIS VERB…we ALL have done it a little! Have a SUPER week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to sponge off More Tupperware? Yeah. My mom made spaghetti. When are you going to quit sponging off your mom?

item.title: 0609 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Tupperware | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s the weekend!! I cook a LOT on the weekend so I don’t have to cook during the week…where do I keep my food! I’ll tell you in today’s podcast! Have a SUPER weekend! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Tupperware More Tupperware? My mom’s got tons. You reuse it, right? Sure! Well, I bring the dirty ones back to her. Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0608 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a knockoff | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today we learn about something that is BAD for BUSINESS…but can be really nice as a consumer. Enjoy the podcast and have a great day! OH! If you are thinking about join DDM, NOW is a great time–on Monday we are starting a new program and it would be great to have you join us. Email me if you want more information–just say Can I join on Monday? (dailydictationmembers AT gmail DOT com) Have a great day!

item.title: 0607 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to freeload/a freeloader | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Someone who NEVER pays, someone who NEVER works, someone who ALWAYS takes, someone who NEVER cleans… Are you one of those people? I hope not!! We all probably know someone like that. What can we call those people? I will tell you in today’s podcast! Have a SUPER day^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to freeload/a freeloader Why do you let Freddie just eat your food? I don’t know.

item.title: 0606 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—the runs (ARE you eating now? If yes, listen later!!!) | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s English expression and dialog: the runs… I don’t think I can go in today. What’s wrong? My stomach. I’ve got the runs. I’ll call your boss. Turn the fan on. Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!) Study English, FREE ENGLISH LESSONS, on our YouTube channels: Support the Let’s Master English team! On PayPal: Send to Or you can go here: Today’s Daily Easy English Expression PODCAST is UP and READY for YOU!

item.title: 0605 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—nauseous | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description If you eat TOO much–especially sweet things–you will feel … If you are pregnant, often you will feel… Taking some types of medication will make you feel… Motion sickness involves feeling… What is …? Listen and find out! Have a super September^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: nauseous You okay? I’m feeling a bit nauseous. Have you thrown up? No, but I think I might. Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0604 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—feel a little warm | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The seasons are changing–where I live, from summer to fall. DO NOT GET SICK! Today, we’ll talk about a common symptom for many people when the seasons change! Stay healthy! See you on Monday^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: feel a little warm Ugh~~ You don’t look good. I feel a little warm. Let’s take your temperature. Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0603 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—wrapped around someone's finger | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you like being CONTROLLED by someone? Of course not! But wait…sometimes it’s okay, right? Maybe if you have a wife or a husband that you love?!! What about a child? Your mom? Maybe you love your boss? (what? who loves their boss? Coach Shane is crazy!!) Anyway, you’ll learn a great expression in today’s podcast–I want you to learn it and then use it!! Have a super day^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: to be wrapped around someone’s finger What are you doing?

item.title: 0602 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Give credit where credit is due~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s English expression and dialog: Give credit where credit is due In British pronunciation they say “better”, but in American pronunciation they say “better”. Hey, your English pronunciation has really improved! Well, it’s thanks to you, Coach Shane. A little maybe, but let’s give credit where credit is due—you worked HARD! Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!

item.title: Thank you! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description I have had a very difficult period…it all started in June and now it is time to start over. Your patience for my lessons is GREATLY APPRECIATED. Have a fantastic week, Coach Shane Transcript

item.title: 0601 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—...smarter than he looks... | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s English expression and dialog: Smarter than he looks Why didn’t you tell your mom where you were? Because she would have worried too much! Wow! You’re smarter than you look! Thanks, dad! Let’s enjoy the game^^ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY! PLEASE support my sponsors: (Get a free AUDIO BOOK!) Study English, FREE ENGLISH LESSONS, on our YouTube channels: Support the Let’s Master English team!

item.title: 0600 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—honest to a fault | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description I 100% believe in telling the truth. Being honest. NOT lying. But…we must agree, sometimes the truth hurts, right? And if YOUR TRUTH hurts someone, then you need to know the expression in today’s podcast. Also, I will tell you HOW TO BE TRUTHFUL without hurting people. That is some VERY valuable advice! Believe me, I have hurt a lot of people and a lot of people have hurt me…but all that pain was unnecessary!

item.title: 0599 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—drop off, drop-off, dropoff! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today we have a word/phrase that can be spelled THREE different ways and have THREE different meanings! The word/phrase is REALLY useful, too! Enjoy the podcast and share it with your friends, please!! ~Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: drop off, drop-off, dropoff Drop me off over here. I dropped off Lucas here, too! It’s the best drop-off point for subway and bus users. I see. Watch your step as you get out–there’s quite a drop-off.

item.title: 0598 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Watch your step~ | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Walking can SOMETIMES be dangerous. Seriously!! There is gum on the road/sidewalk, sometimes you’ll find doggy poop~ What about snow and ice…fresh concrete~ Then there are steps/stairs… What can you say if you and a friend are walking on DANGEROUS ground? Well, today’s podcast has the answer! Enjoy it and laugh! And PLEASE share my podcast with your friends! Have a super week! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: watch your step Let’s hurry!

item.title: 0597 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Give him an inch and he'll take a mile | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It’s ALMOST the end of the week and ALMOST the beginning of the Olympics in Brazil!! Even if you are not a fan of sports, lets all hope for a wonderful, safe, exciting and successful Olympics! Do you have a favorite sport? Let us know! Brazil! Congratulations and BEST WISHES!! Everyone, enjoy today’s podcast! Coach Shane! Today’s English expression and dialog: give him an inch and he’ll take a mile Shane, can I borrow your car this weekend?

item.title: 0596 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—the lowdown | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description If you rely on information from the news or from Twitter or from Facebook–you are not getting enough information. When I buy something on Amazon, I do not only read the product description–I also search the internet for other people who bought the product. I want the important information–then I can make good decisions. That information can be described by Today’s Expression!! Check out today’s podcast and have a super week!

item.title: 0595 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—lock, stock and barrel | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Good MONDAY morning!! Today’s podcast will teach you (remind you?!!) of a great expression that means EVERYTHING! I really like the conversation–it features a lovely, married couple. But, I’m wondering…in real life, in that situation in the conversation…how do “real” couples react? Listen and let me know!! Have a SUPER week, Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: lock, stock and barrel Did you pack everything? Lock, stock and barrel.

item.title: 0594 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a hollow victory | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description TGIF!!! VICTORY!!! Yes, we all love victory. Any victory is good, right? Well, yeah! But…there is one type of victory that is good, but it’s just not excellent. And, probably, we have all had that kind of victory~ My mom planned a picnic for the weekend. I told her, “I think it’s going to rain!” She said, “No!” Well, on the weekend it rained! I won!! But…the picnic was ruined~ How can we describe THAT kind of victory?

item.title: 0593 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—the nitty-gritty | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description When you want PRECISE information, you need TODAY’S EXPRESSION! Have a fantastic week, everyone. Be safe and strong! And be sure to listen to our podcasts to make your English stronger!! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: the nitty-gritty I wish Coach Shane would teach more about pronunciation. He does in DDM and PIRF. He really gets into the nitty-gritty. But I don’t have any money. Investment in knowledge pays the best interest.

item.title: 0592 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—a sub / to sub for…subbing for | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description My number one priority in my work is my students. I will always do my best to enhance their skills, to answer their questions, to push them to the next level. I do my best to ALWAYS be there seven days a week. But…there are times when I get sick. When emergencies happen. When I can NOT be there. So, fortunately, I have a team of guys who are ready to help out.

item.title: 0591 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—Back at you! | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description When someone says something nice to you–when they WISH YOU good, how can we respond? Well, we can always just say “Thank you!” But it is often better to say something like, “Thanks! You, too!” or “The same to you!” In today’s podcast I’ll teach you another expression that you can use in casual conversations with your friends–and with me, too!! I hope you have a FANTASTIC weekend with your friends and family^^ Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: Back at you!

item.title: 0590 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—jumping on the wrong bandwagon | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Today, a little bit of history behind a GREAT expression that you can use in politics and sports! You can use it in your family too!! Enjoy the podcast and ENJOY your weekend! Coach Shane Today’s English expression and dialog: jumping on the wrong bandwagon Semi-Finals t-shirts for the 2018 World Cup. 50% off! Who’s on it? Team USA!! We’re going to the Semi-Finals! The USA?! Ha!! You’re jumping on the wrong bandwagon~ Subscribe on iTunes and get this English podcast EVERY DAY!

item.title: 0589 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to be conned into VERBing | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Do you trust most people? No? If yes, then you are like me. Is that a good thing? Well…it seems like it should be a good thing, but the truth is…many time we become VICTIMS to people who want to use us and take our money. It HAS happened to me several times…I still am the victim sometimes. BUT, I’m getting “better”. I’m NOT so easy~ Check out today’s expression and DON’T let it happen to you!

item.title: 0588 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—to tie one on | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description MANY of us have enjoyed a beer or two. Maybe some whiskey…tequila~ Vodka, rum, gin…wine, champagne. I still LOVE my nightly beer–one can. I really enjoy the taste! But I do remember…years ago…drinking too many beers! And the next day was VERY painful. But when I was drinking the beer–it was great…do you have a similar memory? Was it recent? In those situations, I have a great expression for you to use!

item.title: 0586 Daily Easy English Lesson PODCAST—tit for tat | Daily Easy English Expression Podcast
